author: {'steamid': '76561198075996214', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1487080278}
review:
Es un juego simple, muy llano, pese a ello pide mucha intensidad y concentración. Es para aquellos que busquen un pequeño reto de dificultad. ¡Es muy dependiente de los reflejos!

En sí no encontramos mucha variedad, los tipos de enemigos se cuentan con una mano, pero no te hace falta más. Tu objetivo es conseguir matar el máximo de ellos esquivando en un bullet hell cenital. Para ello dispondremos de una espada y un arma de fuego. Mientras que una nos protejera cortando y también devolviendo proyectiles, el arma se encargará de limpiar el mapa de enemigos.

El juego carece de historia y demás, es un solo mapa, el cual varía cada vez en muros a modo de arena y nos da 90 segundos para sobrevivir tratando de matar el mayor número de enemigos.

Para hacer el juego entretenido y darle una meta, el propio creador nos ha dado una serie de logros los cuales serían el go-to de este shooter poniendo a prueba nuestra habilidad. No es para nada sencillo, y para el precio que tiene se compensa fácilmente.

Recomendado para gente que busque un reto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018243990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1511384265}
review:
Okay, so, [i]UBERMOSH[/i]... I thought it was some random 8-bit crap that I probably won't like. But, I bought it anyway, since it sounded good. 

After installing it, I enter the main menu and feel weirded out by this weird-looking green-haired woman on the screen, but anyway, I go through the tutorial. And so far, it felt easy enough.

I start the game, and I play for like a few minutes. And then, I felt it was a nice buy, and then I quit the game and don't go back to it until I did recently.

20 minutes in, I realise how much this game can tick a person off. I had some negative thoughts about it. Like, why did I even buy an 8-bit crapola like this? Why does my respawn chance go down by one within less than 10 seconds? Why are the bullets firing toward me before I could even see it? Why is the area not big enough? What the fuck is so good about this fucking piece of shit game? 

5 more minutes in, I rage quit. 

Right after that, I calmed down. And then I realise that the game was meant to do just that. To test your skills. [b][u]Git gud or git rekt.[/u][/b] 

What I'm telling you is there's no graphical awesomeness with this game, there's no storyline, there's no concrete objective. You simply survive until your time runs out, which is 90 seconds. That sounds easy, right? Well, it's not. I rage quit, and thought about writing a negative review, just to spite it. And even after all that, this game is really entertaining. It's like one of those games with which you could develop a love-hate relationship. It's also a game which you either get addicted to for a long time, or you come back to occasionally.

The soundtrack is a huge plus. I love it, even though most of the tunes are very similar, so it [b]can[/b] be a bore for some, but that's only if you're the kind whose excitement for things dies off really fast. I, for one, think the soundtrack is what keeps my sanity in control as I slash through my pixelated enemies, because I die in like 30 seconds. Which is infuriating. 

Is it worth the buy? Definitely! Is it worth the buy in its full price? That's upto you, but I bought it during sale, and you ought to buy the full collection. Is it worth the buy during sale? Hell yeah, don't miss it out! And if not for the gameplay, atleast for the music (if you're a metal/rock fan, haters look elsewhere).

There's not much difference between this game and its follow-ups, except for maybe some changes or additions made to the soundtracks, and they're comparatively easier than this one, especially [i]UBERMOSH: BLACK[/i]. Other than that, it's pretty much the same. So, this review applies to all of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059971262', 'num_games_owned': 2465, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1499803657}
review:
Okay. My first impression of this game was "That's it?" "Is it possible to last more than 30 seconds?" 

I spent like 5 minutes and didn't opened the game for several months. 


Now, after distancing myself a bit from the first time... This game isn't half bad! It's actually great! Sure, it's simple, hard, the content feels a bit minimal, but... It's really satisfying. Slashing, shooting hordes of enemies while avoiding bullets... It's a real blast. It's not the kind of game you'll play for a long session, but it's definitely the kind where you'll go back and see if you can survive and beat your best score.

It's hard as nail at first, but once you get the grip on how to play, it's actually quite easy.

It's the usual "arcade game" formula boosted to the max (and perfected) with a rad soundtrack.

 My PB right now is 311! Think you can beat me?

I actually have a lot of hours on this game than it may seem but I know that this is really fun to waste time with and have a blast! The controller function is a bit clunky in my book, but it's something I could get used too. I do recommend this game and its sequels!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089234022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1665713759}
review:
This game is EXTREMELY simple; from the graphics to the controls. However, while simple, it is one of the best small games I've ever had the privilege of playing. The gameplay, being as simple as it is, is extremely easy to pick up and learn. Mastering this game is another story entirely, I got to blade saint after, say, thirty tries. And I just kept going back. The announcer, the oddly satisfying feel of deflecting bullets, the insane moments you can have, the little hint of a story behind the scenes. All in all this game has what it needs to be GOOD, it could be better of course, every game could be better. Also I find my self wanting a multiplayer, defecting one another's bullets sound stupid fun. I wholeheartedly recommend this to anyone with some time to kill or a competitive spirit.
G.G
Mr.E

author: {'steamid': '76561198079795608', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 24, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1712330350}
review:
Watch the trailer. What you see is what you get.

Fast-paced shooting action with a twist.
The twist being that plasma sword that can cut and reflect bullets.

Controls are tight, music is mindblowing, difficulty is harsh.
Last point could be because I'm a scrub.
But it is tons of fun though.

It is one of my favorite guilty pleasures.
Utopian Ultraviolence on Ultakaar.

Oh. Don't measure this game in time played. 
Measure it in heart-beats, never been so pumped up by a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078679059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1523767951}
review:
Now usually I'm a very opened minded sort of guy that doesn't shy away from most games. There are two kinds of games I like, ones with a meaningful narrative that also works into the game play, that's "Oneshot", and one with fast paced kick ass game play, that's "F.E.A.R". Now sometimes those can mix together and make a deformed hybrid of a child that has tourettes [spoiler](makes you swear randomly)[/spoiler] that's your postal 2, which I personally think is one of my favorite games. Too bad that the country I lived in completely forgot the time that they were trying to be important like America [spoiler](its banned if you haven't figured it out)[/spoiler]. 

Now "UBERMOSH" falls into the latter category and I'm happy to say that what it says in the trailer is what it is. It's a fast paced hack and shoot game that is based around your reflexes and judgment skills, and you have to survive waves upon waves of morons for a certain time. 

[u]Gameplay[/u] 
The gameplay is based around your usage of the sword and gun. your sword can cut enemies and deflect bullets back at them, and a gun does what you think it does. There is very little variety in what gun does what and fall into a line graph of the worst to the best. Now you only have 90 seconds to survive which may not sound much, but it does feel like an eternity. Enemies are relentless and will constantly make you twitch around the screen to check your every angle, making it pretty enjoyable for anyone who wants a challenge in less than 5 minutes. 
 
Then you got your classes, you got your classless that starts with a sword, and can grab a gun. Your Kensai that has more health but can't pick up guns. Your gunner that has automatic fire with guns but can't use the sword and has less health and your warlock that starts with the best gun but with the least amount of health. Now obvious problem start to rise like, why would you need a gunner when she fires as fast as when you mash the mouse and why do I need a warlock when I can easily pick up the best gun in seconds. You are most likely to pick classless as your only class because of the variety of options you have and with a decent amount of health. There's probably no reason to pick the other classes unless you want the achievements. 

[u]Artificial intelligence[/u] 
The ai in this game is your standard brain dead, go in with numbers sort of guys. They will come in waves in an attempt to kill the player and even then over a hundred of them are already dead. What they make up for is their twitch movements they try to mimic the player making them unpredictable and some of them have a faster or slower attack speed. They all have one health and only carry guns, so it's nothing to talk a lot about, all you need to know that there are hundreds of them to kill. 

[u]Conclusion[/u] 
There's not really a lot to talk about, I usually talk about atmosphere as well and as interesting as it looks it not necessary. The game has very little content but what it makes up for is it's arcade like action. It's a really cheap game that will take you at least close to two hours to get all the achievements and is not for everyone. If you like fast gameplay like the old "Quake" and "DOOM" games get it if you want to. Your not really missing anything out but if you think it looks good buy it, probably get it on sale. If nothing interests you and you want story narrative games go look at "Lisa", "Undertale" or "Oneshot". I even made a review on "Oneshot" so if you want to know what the game is like, go check out the review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053788131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1483873084}
review:
[h1]OVERVIEW[/h1]
UBERMOSH (all caps) is a style-over-substance twin-stick shooter with a difference: your best weapon is your sword, which can reflect enemy shots.

The story behind UBERMOSH is limited, but there seems to be a degree of 'lore' surrounding the game and other similar ones by the one-man development team, Walter Machado. I won't try to delve into it other than to say that you play an armoured-up woman with a very big glowing sword and in each short (90-second) game you have to try to survive against hordes of gun-toting enemies.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
Graphics have a retro, pixel-graphic appeal to them. They're okay, but not the best pixel graphics I've seen. Animations are okay, too.

The level graphics are fairly bland and uninspired, but I think it is supposed to be a desert, so I guess that fits. In any case, the background gets splattered with gore fairly quickly.

There are no graphics options -- not even a full screen / windowed toggle -- but I found that ALT-ENTER does work for entering windowed mode, in Windows 10 at least, and from there you can resize the window if you want to.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
The music is really not my thing. A lot of people love it, but I really didn't. Sound effects are okay, and even somewhat useful in helping you get into 'the zone' given the difficulty of the game, but since there are no volume settings, and I don't want to listen to that music anymore, I've had to mute the sound effects while playing as well.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
UBERMOSH is a simple twin-stick shooter played in 90 seconds, if you can survive that long. You're dumped in the middle of a procedurally generated level with nothing but your armour and sword, and very shortly after that the game throws hordes of bad guys, aliens, and who knows what else at you.

Killing an enemy leaves a lovely pool of red slop behind, as well as the enemy's weapon, which you can pick up. There are a few different weapon types, with the best undeniably being a gun that fires five red shots in an arc, covering a fairly good portion of the field in front of you. Unfortunately there's no way to lock a weapon once you've picked it up, and with the battlefield quickly becoming littered with blood, gore, and enemy weapons that you'll unintentionally pick up when you run over them, you won't always be able to hold on to your red death for very long.

And that's basically it. There are a few different modes ('character mods') that provide you with different starting weapons and health ('respawns'), and Steam achievements to aim for if just trying to survive for 90 seconds or beating your previous score isn't enough for you. But there's no advancement or reward for playing other than a sense of satisfaction and relief. There doesn't seem to be any online score keeping or anything like that, either, so some fans have started a 'best score' thread with screenshots in the Steam discussions for the game, in case you want to brag.

There's no zooming in or out and the camera moves with you, keeping you in the centre of the screen. Given the aspect ratio, this means that you have less sight range between your character and the top and bottom of the screen than you do at the sides, so enemies coming from the top or the bottom regularly get the jump on you; you'll often find a run ended by an enemy spewing the five red beams of death at you from one of those directions.

For a game that's obviously focused on reaction time and precision, the controls feel a bit sloppy to me. Playing with a keyboard and mouse is a bit frustrating, but the controller is worse. Stick to keyboard and mouse.

[h1]PROS AND CONS[/h1]
Pros:
+ An interesting setting, but one that's not examined in enough depth
+ It's very hard and unforgiving; some people like that
+ Achievements and trading cards

Cons:
- It's very hard and unforgiving; some people don't like that
- Unpleasant music, with no separate sound/music volume settings
- Controls could be a bit tighter
- No advancement or improvement, just the same thing each time
- Its name is in caps

[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]
I'm a fan of most things 'cyberpunk' and I love science fiction twin-stick shooters, so I'd had UBERMOSH on my wishlist for a long time. The store page didn't suggest it was anything but a one-hit wonder, so I wasn't disappointed in the lack of depth in the game, but I had been hoping to enjoy the core gameplay more than I did. As far as the 'cyberpunk twin-stick shooter' genre is concerned, UBERMOSH is the game that I've had the least fun playing.

That said, it is what it is and it doesn't try to pretend to be anything else. You can regularly pick it up for just under 50 cents, sometimes including the soundtrack (not that that's a good thing, from my point of view), so it's also the cheapest game that I've played in the genre.

Given the discounted price and subject matter, it's hard to not recommend UBERMOSH in spite of its shortcomings. But be aware: it's difficult, repetitive, more frustrating than it could be, and there's really not much to it. 

[h1]5/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198115673548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1542826545}
review:
[h1]良バランス良BGMアクションシューター[/h1]
[u]WASDで移動、マウスで狙って攻撃するアクションシューター[/u]です。
近接武器は敵の銃弾を弾き返しメインにもなる高性能
銃器は敵から奪うことができうまく射撃すれば一方的な攻撃が可能。
1フロア90秒間（or死ぬまで）のスコアアタックというルールで
5分もすれば全ての敵・全ての武器が出尽くす程の超シンプルゲーです。

[u]ストアページの動画を見て面白そうなら買いでしょう。[/u]
BGMや効果音や剣で弾くところも実際のゲームそのままです。
90秒生き残るのは結構難しいですがこのジャンルに慣れた人なら
3時間もあれば全実績解除できるでしょう。

一応コントローラープレイもできましたが
移動しつつアナログスティックで照準するのは
テンポの早いこのゲームでは厳しいかな。（慣れの問題かもしれませんが…）

author: {'steamid': '76561197994801267', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1558744968}
review:
Boy, oh boy am I glad that i found this game! In some way, I have been wanting a game like exactly like this, it really tickles something that says to me "yes, you really needed this." and I couldn't agree more.

I guess the best genre for this is bullet hell? There's lots of bullets to dodge and a lot of things to kill, you can cut your enemies bullets with your blade to make them reflect back to their shooters while at the same time multiplying (hence the cut part). There is 3 different class-mods in this one, Kensai, Gunner and Warlock, not counting the default mode.

Superb music imo, and the artstyle makes me imagine some kind of cyberpunk setting especially form the main menu art from all 3 UBERMOSH games, that is certainly what made me look twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061795684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1504409769}
review:
[h1]My wristle hurts, my fingers hurts, my hand hurts. Everything hurts, even my ego.[/h1]
10/10 Original piece but based on Arcade roots. Hard is an understatement, and this is the ''easier'' of the series. The pace and the flow reminds me of [b]Smash TV[/b] mixed with [b]Cannon Fodder[/b] which had [b]Space Mega Force[/b] babies and they had mutated relatives like [b]Total Carnage.[/b] The diference is that you can't just be a powerup swapper and loose gunner. There are brillant yet simple tactical choices to make before you hit for your advantage, from swords only, Handicap balance and to gunner, these classes adds lots of fun.

[h1]A very important game to ever happen to the category on Steam.[/h1]
I've found out that the game was made single handedly by the dev, and the music track was composed by the man! Music here is dope, the main star on my opinion pure and simple.

Game isn't stage based, which I have suggested to add in the past, this game can worn off quickly without that. As this is an indie game you should expect a bit lack of balance on combat, A.I. is kinda predictable at some point but It's pretty addictive regardless. I told people this game would have a future when it came out and I was right. Those things got fixed.

[h1]If you don't like Arcade, maybe this is your chance[/h1]
You should also be looking forward for [b]Ubermosh Black, Ubermosh volume 3, SwarmRiders[/b] that would like moving from sweet strawberry gums from here to red hot chili pepper. Hmmm tastes like the 90s. For some reason I like the main title, must be my 80s mode turning on.

Just make sure you got a fast DPI on your mouse and don't forget to cut the bullets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013282689', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1483396519}
review: It has a hard learning curve until you read some guides and it gets better. As you gain skill you see the beauty, deflections alone is my favorite class. It can be summed up as an arcade-like high score oriented game. The same 90 second round over and over with a few class mod varients and a hard mode that's actually the easier to score mode. Good little game but try to nab it on sale since it's a very small package of content. If you enjoy going deep on a game that starts off simple, like Geometry Wars, this is a good game to check out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087062700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1498218025}
review:
90 seconds, enemy moving in from all sides, and you with a blade to cut bullets in half and perhaps a gun (if the class you select allows it). Sounds easy, right? 

Ubermosh is one of those games I play periodically because it can be a great deal of fun, and it is also one of those games I find myself enraged by, You are spawned into an area with a specific amount of 'respawns' or hits you can take, and you have specific abilities depending on the class you select. This means you can start with a sword only, an automatic gun only,  and mictures in-between. Your health is also adjusted depending on what you select, and this makes it a lot more difficult. 

I picked up the set on the winter sale for a really cheap price, and that makes it worthwhile. The second and third one are fun, and the third removes a lot of the landscape in the game and literally hits you with enemies only. There is also a version that has you on a bike, shooting stuff (i cannot recall the name of it, but I'm not a huge fan). It is fun, and amazing how much time you end up burning in 1 1/2 bursts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258692731', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1561722831}
review:
Отличный пиксельный слэшер. Сюжета нет, но он тут и не нужен. Игра имеет 4 режима. Также присутствует хардмод, который можно включить в меню (за это дают достижение). Рекорды сохраняются только на одной сессии. То есть, когда вы зайдете в игру в следующий раз, ваш рекорд будет обнулен. Музыка в игре очень даже хороша.
Эта игра завлечет вас на несколько часов. Свою цену игра полностью оправдывает. Если вы любитель слэшеров, не проходите мимо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106393807', 'num_games_owned': 1097, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1483185210}
review:
UBERMOSH ist ein extrem schneller "Shooter" - mit ein paar interessanten Ideen. Es spielt in einem Cyberpunk Universum und ist im Arcadestil gehalten.

[h1]Grafik[/h1]
Die Grafik ist, wie bei einem Arcade-Titel zu erwarten ist, sehr verpixelt. Das passt bei UBERMOSH besonders gut, da man sich so auf das Wesentliche konzentrieren kann. Desweiteren wirkt so das Blut der Gegner deutlich mehr als ein Teil des Hintergrunds, den man ausblenden kann.
[b]9/10[/b]

[h1]Sounddesign[/h1]
Die Musik ist ebenfalls passend, wenn auch etwas monoton auf Dauer. Die Kampfsounds sind - wie die Hintergrundmusik - sehr laut. Gut gelungen und ein toller Soundtrack.
[b]8/10[/b]

[h1]Story[/h1]
"The colony provides us everything. Except violence, that we still find in the deserts of Uldakaar".
UBERMOSH hat keine wirkliche Story. Im Tutorial wird lediglich auf die Kolonie hingewiesen, welche alles bieten kann, abgesehen von Gewalt - an der es in diesem Spiel keinen Mangel gibt. Da eine Story hier nicht notwendig ist, werde ich keine Bewertung vornehmen.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Man bewegt sich mit WASD und feuert mit der linken Maustaste, die rechte Maustaste dient dem wichtigsten Feature - das Zerschneiden der feindlichen Kugeln, welche reflektiert werden. Das Ziel ist einen neuen Highscore aufzustellen, eine Runde dauert maximal 60 Sekunden. Es gibt mehrere Klassen zur Auswahl, die alles von nur Schwert und keiner Waffe und nur Waffe und keinem Schwert bieten. Der weitere Modus "Hardboiled" ("Hartgekocht") hat einen separaten Highscore. Es gibt keine Integration mit dem Steam Leaderboard.
[b]10/10[/b]

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
UBERMOSH macht was es soll - und das macht es gut. Angesischts des niedrigen Preises kann ich dieses Spiel voll empfehlen. 
[b]9/10[/b]

Diese Rezension wurde von einem Kurator bei Canis Majoris verfasst.
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CanisMajorisReviews]Canis Majoris[/url]

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198121699512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1629066122}
review:
É demais!

É como levar um tiro de uma escopeta de café expresso na cara a cada jogada.

Recomendo muito se quiser uma experiência frenética e com alto fator de replay. Muito viciante.

Acompanhava o trabalho do Walter desde o Gearcrack Arena, mas só agora pude jogar o Ubermosh. Já fui obrigado a comprar todas as sequências!

A trilha então nem se fala! Comanda toda a experiência desse universo único.

Jogo com muita satisfação e com a impressão de que o jogo foi feito para mim! haha

author: {'steamid': '76561198125294466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1479445277}
review: UBERMOSH is a arcade style shooter/swordplay, i find it very highly addictive due to trying to beat my highscores over and over! It is also very tactical by trying to shoot/slash/dodge all at once. UBERMOSH is a beautifully done masterpiece, i really recommend the UBERMOSH Collection. There's no sense in biting half of a delicious cookie when you can have a whole bundle instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143875641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1454814050}
review:
works GREAT with the steam controller if you're lazy on the couch as I am sometimes, but don't expect the highest of highscores.

I'm a big believer in reliving the glory of arcade setting games, where you have your friends breathing down your neck, helping you pop in quarters before the timer determines the fate of your current high score, I'm a big fan of these arcade games.

Uber mosh is unlike any arcade game you've encountered.

 but you cannot compare it as precise to the old school keyboard and mouse. the reaction time depends on your level of skill which will be tested every blink of your soulfull little eyes, you'll be ripping through attacks (bullets kill you mostly on the first direct hit) and the enemies are as unpredictable as they come. 

If you're a fan of the old' school arcade stick controller era as much as I was, pick this up with the soundtrack, the music on this is underrated and there's no shame on spending the extra pennies on the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352848756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1482232415}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970538611', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1481603251}
review:
Way too difficult. Never survived for more than twenty seconds and never felt like I was getting "better". Could honestly not play this game for more than a few minutes at a time because of how discouraged it made me feel-- something few if any games have ever done. It also didn't help that I often seemed to take damage for no reason, even after performing a successful counter. I despise the way the game dumps you back to the main menu the millisecond you run out of continues; not even a score screen or anything. Feels lazy. 

It's a shame, because the minimalist art design and catchy soundtrack are really well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202963270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1481551593}
review:
11小时=鼠标狂点=解锁5成就=悲催如我
0.1小时=按键精灵=解锁2成就=欢乐时光

全成就感觉一点也不爽！
续作不会再玩了，不过还会继续玩其他游戏作死自虐的。
12.12留念

author: {'steamid': '76561197994715450', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1532879731}
review:
[b]Одним словом: [/b] годнота!
[b]Если кратко:[/b] симулятор джедая под офигенный ост.

[b]Если более развёрнуто:[/b] хардкорный аркадный слешер с двумя уровнями сложности, несколькими классами, офигительным саундреком и клёвой озвучкой (поверьте, этот ушной оргазм при разрубании снарядов вам запомнится). 
У вас есть 88 секунд и небольшое кол-во жизней, меч и пушка (разные пушки которые можно подбирать). И, конечно же, бесконечная толпа прущих болванчиков, которые мечтают о смерти от вашей руки. Рубить! Рубить! Стрелять!

Брать по скидону? Брать однозначно! Причём с саундтреком!
Брать по фуллпрайсу? Только если вы фанат хардкорных аркадных слешеров.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065291025', 'num_games_owned': 1121, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1510344614}
review:
TLDR.; BUY IT NOW!!!!! you won't regret it
I bought this game and it's OST for 0.48 euros. Hands down my BEST arcade buy thus far in my life. I'd even buy it for twice the ORIGINAL price now. Pretty much capped out the achievements in 4 hours, but I think that only happened because I have played a lot of bullet hells before. Back to the review, this is a game with a simple enough control scheme, a kick ass soundtrack, fast gameplay, there are no things against it, but here are some MINOR annoyances that might or might not come up:
-the hitboxes take some time to get used to
-as well as the movement speed of the character
-there are some cases of cheap deaths, especially in the beginning (when the screen scrolls vertically and enemies appear and fire instantly, and initially you don't know how to react, so you are forced to take a hit, but you'll soon learn how to counter this.)
This is a MUST for all bullet hell or arcade fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043938077', 'num_games_owned': 1738, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1511003919}
review:
UBERMOSH is a great arcade twin-stick bullet hell shooter with a cyberpunky retro aesthetic. I recommend this game to anyone who likes pick-up and play games with a good dose of challenge, personality and a classic feeling to them.

It's very basic; you get put into an area with endless enemies and you want to try to get as many kills as you can within 90 seconds or until you run out of lives. You can pick up any of the guns the enemies drop, and slice enemy shots with your sword to split them and send them back. It's simple, but fantastic and satisfying. The guns really feel like they pack a punch because of their sound effects and a minor screen shake whenever you shoot. 

You can somewhat change the experience by changing class mod, which can either take away your sword but give you rapid fire, or take away your ability to shoot so you have to rely on cutting enemy bullets as your only means of attacking. There isn't a whole lot of variety in the content, but if you like this content you can easily play it for hours on end, or keep it installed to play from time to time when you've got some minutes to kill. It's also got the right amount of challenge, since it has a learning curve and is unforgiving from the start, but once you get the hang of the gameplay and patterns it's doable and just a blast.

It's definitely worth the 2 bucks it goes for, and during a sale it will be a steal. Grab the pack, even, and get several great games for nearly no money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195298155', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1480606174}
review:
[b] *ATTENTION* 
Do NOT buy it if you suffer from epilepsy [/b] 
(pretty obvious, but better safe than sorry)


The game concept is pretty simple: you'll keep on shooting, dying, respawning (repeat forever) but it will be so damn fun to see your improvements once you'll start to understand how to survive.


Very very very cheap and beautiful, imo you won't be disappointed if you're into the bullet hell genre. I suggest to buy the bundle with the whole series, it's really worth it.
If you're not sure yet, you can give SWARMRIDERS a try, which is a free short game from the series that will give you a general idea about what you're gonna face (even though it reminds only of Ubermosh's gunner mode)

author: {'steamid': '76561198277703123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1509689523}

author: {'steamid': '76561198140840989', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1561535099}
review:
这是一个很赞的小游戏，我玩了很久，多数都是离线游戏，这游戏操作简单但是难以精通，节奏也很快，我为数不多的喜加一。
一般玩玩大一些的游戏这种小游戏可能看都不看，但是自从发现之后就喜欢上这款游戏，慢慢去打，慢慢的练习，其实也是蛮有趣的。推荐入手，虽然可能会喜加一。

author: {'steamid': '76561198340226043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1478832760}
review:
초코우유냐, 게임이냐 갈등하는 게이머들을위해서, 껌보다 싼가격에 구매 가능한, 스트레스 해소용 게임이다. 

껌보다 싼 가격으로, 재미를 한것 즐길수 있는 게임. 

직장상사한테 욕먹고 열받은 사람들이 껌대신 상사를 생각하며 나오는 적들을 파괴 할수 있는 게임이다. 

게임 메케닉이 어려울 것도 없고, 순간 순간 날라오는 총알들을 피하면서 타격감이 좋은 게임이다. 

돈이 없는 저금리 시대에 개이득인 게임이다.

review:
打折时购入……
BGM很带感，配合游戏画面有种魔之风味。
然而身为手残党果然还是hold不住这款游戏啊，最长活了48秒（死吧？），尝试数次后决定暂时放弃……
就价格而言，打折时值得入手，就是为了音乐包都很值得。

author: {'steamid': '76561198330759968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1544164098}
review: I love this game! It can be quite frustrating at first, but with practice, the movement, speed, accuracy and timing become more fluid. At one point I focused on how my fingers and mouse hand were functioning and coordinating so precisely and I was amazed. There is a learning curve, but eventually you'll mosh like a boss. So glad I've experienced this game and definitley recommend it to anyone who loves a difficult, fast=paced experience. I forgot to mention the awesome soundtrack. There, I mentioned it. It awesome! Enjoy!

review: Very addicting arcade-style shooter, a lot like Smash TV. It's easy to get stuck on walls, and not having any invincibility frames after you lose a life is a bit harsh, but it adds to the challenge, I guess. Well worth checking out though, it's a lot of fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198157300993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1479156002}
review:
[h1]Режь, рассекай, руби, стреляй, беги.[/h1]

Классный кибер-панковский аркадный пиксельный шутер с видом сверху? Во как!)Эта игра много раз мелькала у меня перед глазами в списках рекомендаций, решил, что пока есть возможность, взять ее по скидке еще и прихватив саунтрек, который оказался просто замечательный! Игра сначала покажется сложной, просто так музыку не послушаешь) Разные классы, много оружия, разнообразные пришельцы - это одни из немногих плюсов игры. Потребуются прямые руки, чтобы получить все достижения всех классов. После получения всех достижений интерес к игре может пропасть, или наоборот вас затянет, если вы захотите ставить всё новые и новые персональные рекорды(пока что мой рекорд: 285).Ребят, советую купить годную и недорогую игру, не пожалеете

review:
Petit jeu simple d'arcade, dont on reste accroché malgré tout. En 90 secondes, vous devez éliminé un max de créatures. Par contre, vous êtes limité en vie. Vous en deviendrai fou, et attendez-vous a recommencer plusieurs fois.

review:
Рассказ о том как я купил новую мышку.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049456019', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1482114652}
review:
Crimsoland без динозавров, но с мечом.


Знаю, игра не нова, так что моё графоманство не будет не особо актуальным. Взял её только что потому, что уже долго мозолила глаза своим названием и даже не знал, что там внутри.

А внутри там:

 - ГГ и орды каких-то инопланетян
 - Несколько видов оружия
 - Меч, которым можно рубить врагов и отбивать снаряды обратно
 - Модификаторы классов, например, можно играть вообще без меча, но пушки будут лупить с огромной скоростью. И наоборот, если на голове у вас растёт сакура и вы чувствуете себя самураем, оружие с врагов вам поднимать запретят, только меч, зато ХП побольше.
 - Драйвовая музыка

Цель всего этого действа — продержаться 90 секунд, а по ходу дела нарубить врагов на ачивки. В общем, я под впечатлением и рад, что наконец её взял. А т.к. сейчас она вместе с саундом стоит всего 9р — советую брать. 

Не уверен, отдал бы я полную цену за это (скорее всего нет), но поверьте, в магазине сложно найти что-то сравнимое по интересности за такие смешные деньги.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213641249', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1481867877}
review: Весьма прикольная игрушка, но на пару вечеров. После получения всех ачивок и карточек, скорее всего вы про неё забудете. 2 режима игры, типа норм и хард, 4 класса 1 персонажа. Не хватает таблицы лидеров, можно было бы посоревноваться. В общем по скидке однозначно брать, я приобрел данный проект так сказать на сдачу) UBERMOSH + Original Soundtrack = 9 рублей! Чуть не забыл) Очень и очень годное музыкальное сопровождение. Поймаете ритм и получите +10 к скилу)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063384919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1558947667}
review:
Купил игру по скидке за 9 рублей и отбил цену стоимостью карточек, так что первый плюс игры это "бесплатность".
Войдя в игру я ,почему-то ожидал чего-то интересного и получил бодрый и максимально простой в механике геймплей рогалик. Все, что вам требуется это стрелять и махать мечом (который к тому же отбивает пули врагов) на полупустой карте.
Даже такой криворукий игрок, как я смог получить ранг S+, когда понял лучшую тактику в игре: бежать вперед и стрелять на опережение. Враги тоже так делают, поэтому они мне и подсказали эту стратегию боя. стрелять назад нет никакого смысла, стоять на месте или разворачиваться равносильно смерти, а так вы всегда прорубаете перед собой врагов, как лианы в джунглях и спокойно проживаете необходимое время.
Не брать игру глупо, ведь она мгновенно окупит себя карточками в Стим.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105332516', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1478332816}
review:
Me basto jugar 3 partidas para encantarme el juego y a la vez ver un error tan grande que si lo arreglan sera muy disfrutable, ALEJEN LA CAMARA POR EL AMOR DE DIOS, no se si es que el juego es tan simple que necesitaron acercar la camara hasta el punto de que cuando aparecen los enemigos no te da tiempo de reaccionar, bueno, uno si, pero de repente aparecen 10 en pantalla a la vez y es practicamente imposible esquivar, talvez eso es lo que querian los desarrolladores, no lo se, pero el unico objetivo es sobrevivir lo maximo posible en un mapa donde la dificultad esta basada en el numero de enemigos que literalmente te es imposible ver venir en un determinado momento, el problema es que nada te incita a seguir jugando, las partidas duran tan poquito y cuando pierdes no sientes que sea por que te falte habilidad, que si, pero no se siente, por la camara que te limita la vision.

YA NI SIQUIERA ES QUE EL JUEGO SEA FRUSTANTE, ES QUE DIRECTAMENTE CUANDO LO JUEGAS UNAS 10 VECES PARECE QUE YA LO JUGASTE TODO

Por ejempo, en velocibox es tambien un juego super rapido y las partidas duran nada, pero cuando pierdes te queda la sensacion de que sabes que no reaccionaste a tiempo, en este juego ni siquiera me queda claro si llegado un punto algo va a cambiar aparte de la cantidad de enemigos que es obvio, pero bueno, el juego por el precio se merece un recomendado, pero es tan simple su problema y tan facil de arreglar que no lo recomendare, pero si te sobra el dinero, y no te tiene que sobrar mucho, yo lo compre a 5 pesos mexicanos, que es menos de medio dolar, pues compralo y pruebalo por ti mismo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096713277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1478239053}
review:
This game is everything people say it is. Action, bullets, and swords. The game sounds nice and feels really smooth to play however due to that smoothness I felt like there wasn't any real feedback wich will bring me to my next point.

Although the game is good, and is a must have if you like old school arcade games or bullet hell shooters, the thing that really turns me off is the feedback.

I like to really get into the games I play but here with the slippery movement, and seemingly random deaths I just can't do that. I really hope that this game will see some patches to address the feedback issue about getting hit. Plus the way it just suddenly shows you a game over screen just feels hacky. (Although maybe the intent is to make you rage, so you can get going.)

However I am still going to recommend this game because at this price it's a steal. (CDN$0.49 at the time of purchase.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198256134690', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1498823674}
review:
[h1]是男人就坚持90秒[/h1]

这款游戏主打就是爽快，砍杀，格挡。坚持90秒已经不简单了，但对于每个汉子来说真正的爽快就是杀入敌阵，左右格挡，然后杀出一条血路。
本款游戏的BGM搭配也是极佳，和整个游戏搭配起来有一种经典街机的感觉。整个游戏节奏很快，需要保持一定的紧张度，因此当死亡的时候也会有一种释放的快感，就如同高潮一般。
千万不要用手柄进行游戏，挥砍和格挡默认键位为rt实在太有感觉。

author: {'steamid': '76561198281912682', 'num_games_owned': 1790, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1478073723}
review:
全成就撒花~
本来是挂完卡已经扔到“挂完”组里基本不见天日了的游戏，但是结实了@推倒猫耳娘之后，看到他有这游戏的全成就，而且有这游戏的指南之后，让我挖出了这款游戏，真的是差点就错过了这么刺激的游戏。
音乐非常震撼，
移动有些许发飘，
每开一枪，屏幕都是震的，但是丝毫不让人发晕。
游戏一共四个模式，在左上角切换
一般（NO）模式：4血，可使用刀，拾取枪支
枪手（GUNNER）模式：3血，不可使用刀，枪支连发子弹
术士（WARLOCK）模式：2血，可使用刀，拾取枪支
剑圣（KENSAI）模式：6血，只能使用刀。
刀可以弹反怪物的子弹，可以杀怪（根本不敢冲上去硬肛好伐，或者错位避开枪管杀敌），刀的作用范围比动画范围是要大上一圈的。
子弹不管是自己射出的还是反弹的，飞出屏幕很远也还是能杀敌的
成就，个人感觉剑圣模式的成就最难，反弹还是要看准时机，不然收刀的时候子弹过来非常尴尬，角色跑得比子弹快，走位要小心，太莽撞到子弹可不好。选的是地图右下角两块中等距离的障碍物之间感觉最这边地形适合此模式。
生存90S的成就是貌似是有分数要求的，龟缩防守一般达不到要求，尽量还是在枪手模式下完成。

author: {'steamid': '76561198308183354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1478617465}
review:
异星御姐的绝地厮杀

简单，粗暴，爽快的游戏。

打折时候一块，你买不了吃亏买不了上当

全成就之后说一些个人的心得

游戏初上手的几把会让类似我一样的手残党感受到这个游戏的恶意，因为你活不过一分半钟orz
有耐心多试几遍的话就可以进入游戏的节奏，除非是被怪包围或者怪物一边射一边和你撞个满怀，要不是还是挺安全的。边走边朝你走的方向射击，防止怪物撞脸，枪不能乱射剑不能乱弹，注意看清，弹幕速度其实不快。

杀敌150系列稍微认真玩一下基本都可以过。7次200建议用开局二血的模式，因为可以节省找枪的时间，而且其他模式就算你掉到二血也不一定能得到最好这把枪，浪费时间，得不偿失。存活7次建议剑圣模式。边走边弹或者绕着边界跑跑砍砍，或者躲在岩石背后等怪聚过来，再去躲下一块，因为血量多，所以尝试几次即可达成。

上吧，兄弟们，证明你不是手残党的时候到了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198080472994', 'num_games_owned': 1989, 'num_reviews': 542, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1477601655}
review:
Я не знаю что писать, поэтому я напишу рецепт кeксов "Нежность".

Ингредиенты:
Мука пшеничная — 200 г
Пудинг (любой, у меня ванильный, 1 пакетик) — 37 г
Разрыхлитель теста	— 3 ч. л.
Сахар — 150 г
Молоко — 100 г
Яйцо куриное (средние) — 3 шт
Масло сливочное (мягкое, или маргарин) — 200 г
Ванильный сахар — 1 пакет.


Рецепт:
1.Перемешать пудинг с мукой и разрыхлителем и просеять через сито.
2.Добавить остальные ингредиенты
3.И взбить всё миксером минуты две, до полного исчезновения комочков.
4.Выложить тесто в формочки. Если формочки железные, то смазать их маслом и присыпать мукой. Если силиконовые, то смазывать не надо. Хотя я почему-то боюсь рисковать и всё равно их смазываю по старой привычке :-D 
Выпекать в разогретой до 180 градусов духовке 25 минут!
5.Готово

author: {'steamid': '76561198056739666', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1480115079}
review:
I can happily say that UBERMOSH is one of the most entertaining games I have played in a while. In this game, your objective is to survive in a mosh pit for 1 minute and 30 seconds, using your laser sword to reflect the enemies' bullets back into them, making up for a great defense mechanism, and to eventually pick up their guns and start your own carnage in the pit. 
The retro art style is lovely and really matches the game's theme while the soundtrack is amazingly energizing, fueling your space killing-sprees. There are several arenas in which you can fight ( randomly chosen by the game when you start a new run), but the only difference between them is the colour of the environment. Your arsenal is not really big but it is varied and has lots of uses: besides your sword, you can equip up to 5 (aproximate number) guns that are dropped by the endless incoming waves of enemies, each having different fire modes ranging from a shotgun to a single charged shot or a flurry of bullets widespread in a cone of fire. 
The game comes with 4 combat modes: the ordinary one, in which you have 3 lives and can use your sword and any gun you pick up; the "kensai" mode, in which you cannot pick up any firearms, relying only on your sword and starting the run with 6 lives; the "gunner" mode, in which you have no sword but any gun you pick up fires in a full-auto mode; or "warlock", in which you start with the best gun in the game and can use your sword, but you get only 2 lives. 
If you're looking forward to a greater challenge than what the base game has to offer, hardboiled mode is here to satisfy your needs, representing a much difficult twist on the base game that resets your overall score when you switch to it.
You can also get trading cards and easy-to-obtain achievements when playing the game, which adds to the value and makes the price worth it. In my opinion, UBERMOSH will not let you down if you're looking for a good time-killer or just for some good old top down shooting action, and I would strongly suggest buying it.

TL;DR: With a difficulty level that reminisces good old arcade games, UBERMOSH brings some new elements to the retro top down shooter template, and it will get you a decent 2 or 3 hours of fun for a really good price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230253720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1476131676}
review:
Представьте себе великую мясорубку под названием кримсонленд. Представили? - Так вот, эта игра даже и близко не дотягивает ДАЖЕ до звания клона.
- Тут всего 4 вида оружия и различается оно только расбросом;
- Несколько видов врагов, но отличаются они этим же оружием, да и ведут себя эти кретины странно - могут бегать туда сюда ничего не делая, а могут строчить как в жопу укушенные. То есть вы можете вообще не испытывать сложностей, а в другой момент вас разорвут за доли секунд (учитывая то, что период неуязвимости после ранения составляет 0,000001 секунды)
- одна унылая карта;
- нет перков\прокачки\поверапов;
- нет миссий, режимов и прочего, единственное чем вы можете занятся, так это выбиванием 7 ачивок.
- Раздражает то, что у вас очень маленький обзор и докучи экран трясет от каждого выстрела (а стрелять вы будете всегда)
Да, есть несколько классов, но по сути это вариации одного и того же, при чем класс "варлок" очень проигрывает остальным ИМХО
Ну и тут есть меч, это единственное что спасает игру от оценки в 0 баллов.
...
Итого: 
игра больше похожа на демо-версию, проходится быстрее чем падают карточки, а надоедает еще раньше.
Не брать ни в коем случае!
за меч - 2\10
...
UPD:
Я еще обнаружил, что у авторов хватает наглости продавать одну и ту же самую игру 3 раза!!!, с маленькими различиями типа - без камней\с камнями на карте - верх наглости. (Даже не ДЛС БЛДЖАД, а тупо еще раз продают игру с отличиями которые должны быть в игре сразу в меню опций)
Положительные отзывы либо проплачены, либо написаны теми кто не видел кримсонленд.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319842900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1472173840}
review:
UBERMOSH. É um jogo em 2D, de ação, cyberpunk, onde você controla uma mulher muito foda.

No jogo, você simplesmente, controla um mulher muito foda, onde você, pode usar várias armas, para poder matar seus nimigos. O jogo se baseia em Waves. E você tem que sobreviver ao máximo possível, sem ser morto, pelo inimigos. Fazendo assim, você completar objetivo no jogo. Você tem algumas classes diferente no jogo. Onde você muda completamente a jogabilidade da personagem. E com essas classes. Você pode simplesmente completar objetivos, ou, jogar com elas, por que são massas pra caramba. Deixa o jogo mais difícil também... um pouco mais eu acho.

Gráficos desse jogo é muito foda. Não tenho mais nada a dizer. Além dele ser muito colorido, e, brilhoso.

Historia desse jogo... PUF... PRA QUE HISTÓRIA, QUANDO VOCÊ PODE SAIR MATANDO GERAL.

Trilha sonora desse jogo, é foda pra caralho na boa. Da vontade de sair pela rua, dando tiro em geral, cortando os nego com Katana Cyberpunk. E sendo feliz a cada morte, que nós fizer no jogo.

Dificuldade desse jogo, é simplesmente boa. Ela é difícil, mas, não tão filha da puta assim. Apenas se concentr, e, pronto, você consiguirar passar de boa.

 UBERMOSH, vale muito a pena, você comprar esse jogo. E um bom jogo para você jogar, quando não tiver ideia do que jogar. Além de você mata geral, com armas fodas, e com classes fodas. Você simplesmente ouve uma trilha sonora do caralho.

Comprem sem pensar duas vezes. u---u

author: {'steamid': '76561198128395991', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1471680111}
review:
UBERMOSH, an extremely simple, yet balls to the wall hard game with an amazing rocking soundtrack & a top-down view of the action. Story is simple & quick to the point, cyberpunk utopian future colony where violence, crime & poverty is a non-issue but violence is a “basic need”, so what better way to blow off much needed stress than dropping you in a hostile environment. That is basically it, you are armed with a sword, which you can use to deflect enemy bullets back at them or slice them. Guns are dropped by enemies, simply running over them picks them up. The guns are nothing special, each have their own bullet spread and there is a total of 5 different guns. The game has a simple premise, basically your difficult to survive horde/score attack type of game. You are given 90 seconds & 4 lives on the basic mode of play. There are 4 modes or class mods as the game call them: Kensai, limits you to only use your sword, Gunner only guns & Warlock, which gives you the “best” gun as well as the being able to use your sword. Your amount of lives varies between each mod. Gunplay is average serving more to thin the numbers rather than being your main method of attack, the sword being your main weapon & “shield”, with its ability to deflect bullets, against the onslaught. Despite the enemy bullets coming in hard & fast, they are brightly neon colored so you have a decent chance of being able to evade/deflect them.

Ubermosh can be played with both a mouse/kb & controller. It does not feature a graphical setting menus or any other menu for that matter. The game is extremely short considering it doesn’t really have story to tell & consists of nothing more than fighting the horde of enemies for 90 seconds or your death. There was a minor flaw involving the walls, in which having you move next to them it just stops your movement & gets you stuck to them which is an annoyance in such a fast paced game. No leaderboards as well, so you will have to resort to sharing score the old fashioned way.  All in all, despite that minor flaw, it is a decent time waster with a pretty cool soundtrack that will have you head banging along to the beat as you slice & dice your way through the horde..

review:
Sadly, i cannot recommed Ubermosh, as much as i wanted to.
When i first saw it, the thoughts of "its smash tv + cyberpunk, what could possibly go wrong?" crossed my mind; but wonky hitboxes, unprecise movements, gigantic bullets that are difficult to deflect/dodge and the complete lack of content makes this a game that should have been free on Newgrounds...and even then, its a 15 minutes curiosity at best.

I will have to praise the soundtrack at the very least.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978564782', 'num_games_owned': 1417, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1475246034}
review:
tldr; great game, easily worth the full price.  Some wonkyness in terms of bullet spawn and hitboxes, but it's consistent and predictable with some practice, and fun from the start.


[b][u]My take[/u][/b]
If you consider yourself a twitch gamer, this gem will test your mettle.  If you consider yourself patient, this game will cause you to re-evaluate.  If you like a challenge, the achievements associated are a feather for your cap (especially Kensai CM).

This game has stones - big ones.  And rage.  And an awesome soundtrack.

Games last 90 seconds or less - if you're a winner it'll end at 90 seconds no matter what.  Short, simple, video arcade runs are the only thing this game is; variations include random spawn, 4 class mods (CMs), 5 types of gun (sounds low but it's more than enough), and a couple of different maps (always random).

There is some predictability to enemy movement but they'll surprise you, too.  A small visible area  is a *feature* of the game designed to make it twitchy, but to compensate, bullets move slow enough that you can [i]almost[/i] outrun them... but not quite.  In other words, it's balanced.

VERY nice work, devs!

[u]Pros:[/u]
~Controls are both simple and intuitive
~Game action is smooth and uniterrupted
~Excellent soundtrack, appropriate to game action
~Game has NEVER crashed or glitched in ~13 hours play

[u]Cons:[/u]
~Some will find hitboxes glitchy, but it can be learned and compensated for
~Some will not like bullet spawn being in front of the gun, rather than enemy giving indication of firing
~Some will not like minor screen shake upon being hit by enemy fire
~Player cannot slide along walls, meaning, you can't move diagonally in the direction of a wall that you're already touching; you have to clear the wall first

***A note as to the "Cons" - having a dozen hours of playtime invested, I have found these things to be [i]features,[/i] rather than negatives, because they are predictable and one can adjust play to compensate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1569551399}
review:
(Special thanks to Spookymcslave to providing this game.  Thanks, man.  :) )

[h1]You walk into the arena to hear the crowd cheering before you witness an army before you.  Were they cheering for a mountain of bodies or your head on a pike?[/h1]

[i]UBERMOSH[/i] is an arcade-style arena game with minimal story and plug-and-play action with 4 playstyles to choose from and challenging achievements.  Overall, it was pretty fun.

As stated before, [i]UBERMOSH[/i] is by no means easy, but it is possible to complete within 90 minutes (about as long as it took me while watching the first presidential debate of 2016).  Scoring high while overwhelmed in an arena that's almost danmaku-like can be quite a challenge, especially while more and more troops spawn in, firing their weapons at you (Hope you've been practicing your [i]Touhou[/i]).  The gameplay is said to randomly generate arenas too, though I'm not sure if they're truly random or if there's simply a library of arenas in which one pre-made arena is chosen.  Either way, the randomized(?) arena gives this title more replayability.

The music to this game is awesome, the graphics look sweet, and the gameplay is solid, making this a positive experience even if the difficulty is ramped up.  The girl on the title screen also isn't bad to look at either. (in my opinion, at least)

Now, the game is ordinarily priced at $2, but when it goes on sale, it only costs $0.50, which feels to be a fair price.  I highly recommend grabbing this when it goes on sale.

8/10  A retro-style arena shooter that is worth your time.  How many lives will you claim before yours is claimed as well?

author: {'steamid': '76561198211011373', 'num_games_owned': 3462, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1473424668}
review:
此游戏为街机玩法，2D像素风格射击游戏。左手刀，右手枪，战场上依然是你一人对战成吨的敌人，成吨的弹幕袭来；作为主角的你，一个竜神の剣を喰らえ，弹幕尽数被反弹回去，留下一地的枪和.......呃。

街机游戏遵循重复多周目玩法，但此游戏玩多了会觉得厌烦，因为，此游戏在猫某看来，仅仅就是一款用来练习技巧和走位以及反映速度的“Roguelike”模拟器，若是此游戏的7个成就都能独自完成的话，那么市面上的这些自瞄准星像素风格类型的Roguelike游戏，你也基本上掌握了其技巧了。推荐！

[spoiler]猫某用变速齿轮把游戏速度调到了2.5x，那酸爽简直不是一般的正宗，你们口以试试。[/spoiler]

review:
上下左右から迫り来る敵を倒していって
1分半生き延びるだけの全方位シューティングゲーム｡

銃4種のうちいずれかと近接攻撃を使い分けて耐え忍ぶ｡
銃は全て弾数無限｡敵の弾は近接攻撃で弾き返すことができる｡
まぁ､それだけの内容｡画面の表示領域が狭くて死にやすいので､
向かって下側を､壁を背にして戦うようにするスタイルが安定｡

トレカ・実績対応､日本語未対応だが問題なし｡価格は手頃｡
全実績解除まで1～3時間｡値段相応のボリュームしかないが
意外と面白かった｡主人公のお姉さんというかおばさんの
なんだか薄気味悪いストア画像のせいでだいぶ損してる気がする｡

author: {'steamid': '76561198108107464', 'num_games_owned': 1039, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1497609678}
review:
别看我点了推荐，不推荐，真心不推荐。点推荐，只是不想让别人觉得我是那种因为自己弱鸡苦手就借口说游戏不好的人罢了。

[h1]先说优点[/h1]
+BGM算是蛮燃的
+画风比较简单粗暴，对爱好者来说算是好的
+剑圣模式（Kensai）下弹反攻击很爽块，叮叮叮的声效，会让你欲罢不能

[h1]好了，下面是缺点，就一个字[/h1]

[strike]太TM[/strike][h1]难[/h1][strike]了！[/strike]

1、相比敌人数量、弹道速度和移动速度来说，操作视野真的好小。正当你（我）以为自己绕圈跑就能把四面八方的敌人都照顾到的时候，后背冷不防会突然冒出个敌人，然后你（我）就会吐一口老血想要重来。
2、一方面，敌我双方都是范围性伤害，敌人数量奇多；另一方面，经常会有莫名其妙的小兵不要命地摸你（我）一下或者自杀式撞你（我）背后，你（我）挡都挡不住，绕都绕不开，只能在悲伤无奈中打出GG。（好歹设定敌方互伤啊！枪零弹雨中还TM有自杀式恐怖袭击，你逗我呐！玩个球啊！）
3、剑圣模式下，弹反攻击的有效角度范围并不像想象中那么大。经常会出现这样的情况：躲在墙角里的你（我），以为开着按键精灵蹲坑就能过关，结果却被各种看起来已经反弹回去的子弹不断地打掉血。
4、Warlock模式真的很坑：两次开火的间隔设定不合理，实在太久了，而且还只有两格血。经常四面八方的敌人涌过来，你（我）不断地走位却来不及开枪扫清敌人，最后因为没法突围而死。

要全成就真的很难。

我TM居然和这个+1性质的游戏死磕了五六个小时，真的也是没谁了……删游戏了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198096466219', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1473583389}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005492940', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1473073055}
review:
Игра похожая на Crimsonland. Бегаем по экрану и отстреливамся от противника.
Собираем стволы с противников, отбиваем снаряды катаной.
Стилистика киберпанк, графика пиксельная.
Замечательная игра, скажем на 3 из 5. 
Просто за счет того, что эта игра нереиграбельна и может надоесть довольно быстро. 
В ней нет души и того, за чем игрок будет возвращаться в неё.
Замечательная музыка, низкая цена, неплохая графика. Подождите распродажи и покупайте.
В игре нет ничего плохого, скорее недостает хорошего.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000917649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1473541449}
review: Абсолютно минималистическая игра. И в этом ее прелесть. Я играл в нее всего чуть чуть и больше никогда играть не буду. Здесь нет прогресса, нет цели. Но я рекомендую игру тем, кто любит забить свободные 5 минут драйвом. В игре - забавная боевая механика: стреляем из разнообразного оружия по врагам, а их пули отбиваем мечом. Такой минимализм не забивает голову, и можно иногда просто посидеть, попробовать побить свой рекорд. Но брать только на распродаже - это о-о-очень минималистичная игра.

review: Игра в стиле "Убей их всех". Не сказать, что я особый любитель игр подобного жанра, но по настроению могу поиграть некоторое время. Игру я рекомендую не за геймплей, а за убойный саундтрек в стиле тяжелого рока (даже скорее, в стиле альтернатива), есть несколько отличных треков (например, Gunclub и Blades), правда без вокала. Игру + саундтрек я купил со скидкой за 9 руб., что считаю отличным приобретением за эту цену, особенно с учетом коллекционных карточек. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198066707252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1592876367}
review:
Pros:
-Awesome adrenaline rush
-Cool type of game (overhead pixel shooter)
-Cool game mechanic (swords deflecting bullets)
-More than one class to switch it up
-Competetive achievements

Cons:
-Probably not much replay value, I bought it an hour ago and played it the whole time and plan on going back but I can see myself not putting over 10 hours on it, probably in 15-60 min sessions.

8.5/10
I love this game. I paid a dollar for it, thanks to a 50% off coupon from a badge, and instantly got an hour of gameplay out of it. I always thought if I can get an hour per dollar spent on a game, it's worth it and this game nailed that on the head.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995061416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1472614697}
review:
Can't recommend this one. Repetitive, with little replay value.

Multiple character classes kept me coming back to it, but the core game just isn't there. It's fast, bright, and flashy, sure, but it really boils down to running from one end of the map to the other, slicing up the same few randomly spawning enemies.

Some of the mechanics are pretty cool, slicing enemy bullets to launch them back at the enemy is pretty satisfying the first few times you do it, but it's not something to hold an entire game up.

The shooting's a headache. Firing shakes the screen so much that it more often than not disoriented me to the point of losing track of my character and running face-first into my death. I stuck mainly to the sword after that.

Enemies spawn around the map at random. There's no set pattern or waves. Any high-scoring round I played felt to me more like a stroke of luck than an accomplishment.

I paid fifty cents for this game, and I'm still considering a refund.

review:
one of the dankest arcade games you'll ever play
fun as hell, 90 seconds of blissful mayhem
also one of the hardest arcade games you'll ever play
if you're familiar with trying to get the 250k score trophy on Kung Fury: Streets of Rage
then Ubermosh will be right at home for you. Not for the sluggish and slow of reflex.
Music is amazing too, every gun blast adds a kick to the beat and the blood doesn't stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027456338', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1495510784}
review:
[h1]UBERMOSH[/h1]
[b]Muchas balas, no la gran cosa... PERO MUY ENTRETENIDO [/b]
Compré el juego con el soudtrack en rebaja del 90%, pero hubiera pagado su precio total igual por el soundtrack.

Es un Bullet-Hell sin aviones, y Arcade.
Tienes que tener buenos reflejos.
Recomendado para cuando no tienes mucho que hacer quiere jugar por un buen rato.


[h1][b]En números y resumen[/b][/h1]
[b]Categoría]:[/b] Indie
[b]Duración:[/b] Corto, pero los logros toman tiempo.
[b]Precio:[/b] Vale la pena si esta en rebaja a a partir de 20%.
[b]Punteo:[/b] 8/10 
[b]Que mejoraría:[/b] Puede ser un poco más complejo para jugar, y si le agregara historia valdría más la prena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153183444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1532699268}
review:
Итак, поговорим об игре Ubermosh. Простенького вида платформер с кучей врагов. Цель - выживать как можно дольше. Правда, я не понял, при чем тут киберпанк. Скорее альтернативная вселенная. 
Выжить здесь трудно. Вас будут окружать и плаить в спину люди и гуманоиды, похожие на Веномансера из Доты 2. 
Вы думаете, что у вас отличная реакция  - ошибаетесь. Просто начните играть в эту игру, и в этом убедитесь. 
Здесь есть несколько видов оружия, причём они различаются по цвету пуль и по типа стрельбы. Начиная с тяжелых, больших патронов, заканчивая дробовиками. Далее естоит отметить, что здесь есть несколько режимов игры. 
И самое сладкое на последок. Мы можем отбивать пули! У нас(ну у вас) есть меч, который атакует с такой нифига себе скоростью, что позволяет нам мнгновенно выносить до 3 врагов одновременно (по крайней мере, у меня больше не получалось).
Итак, мы видим сложный survival плаформер с геймплеем типа ходи убивай, мы видмм малую цену, на которую и так делают скидки. Я приобрел эту игру за 20 рублей, остался доволен. Но вот в чем соль - она может быстро надоесть. 

Итог - рекомендую к покупке. Хотя бы просто для того, что худо-бедно развить реакцию. Кстати, не бойтесь отсутствия языка. Интерфейс понятный, кнопка PLAY самая большая, а дальше человек с детсадовским английским разберется.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013343682', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1561860391}
review:
I like the game, but steam sees reccomendation as black and white, and looking at the current score (92%) I think this game doesn't deserve such a high note. But whatever I guess I am going to have to stick to this system...

Pro :
-Music is really cool, I like how it evolves arround the same instrument
-Gameplay overall is really cool and fun
-really simple and easy to pick up
-cheap
-doesn't ACTUALLY need 512 mb of gpu, you can play it on anything pretty much .

Con :
-Getting an ennemy spawn and shoot you instantly
-melee and ranged weapon takes time to switch (so you will press fire ranged weapon, then melee weapon and it won't work, which sucks because this is a fast paced game, and there shouldn't be a delay between the two)
-And as some other people said before the camera could be placed farther away, or better yet, ajustable.
-lack of diversity
-no way to return to main menu with a controller

Yes, the game is simple, lack game modes and such, plus it only has 4 class mods, but it only costs two dollars, when not 75% off on a steam sale, which makes it 0.50$. For that price, this is an excellent game I would give it a solid 85%.

Note : This game is a score attack obviously, you will die constantly, if you are the kind of person who doesn't enjoy this, don't consider this game, unless you have an extra 0.50% and that you don't know what to do with it, you should just keep it honestly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102975449', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1481459278}
review:
This game provides great entertainment in small bursts of 90 seconds with a resonable price of 2$.

Visually, the game is heavily inspired by cyberpunk themes. Colorful sprites, striking menu artwork and even the font all help bringing its Sci-fi asthetics home. Most of the tracks in the OST are heavily inspired by heavy metal, featuring distorted guitar riffs and crisp drum-and-bas that never fails to get your blood pumping hand your head banging.

Gameplay wise, Ubermosh takes place in the Ultakaar desert. You have one goal, and one goal only: SURVIVE. Right off the bat, the game's flaws began to rear its ugly head: enveloping the desert is the enemy spawnpoint, referred ingame as Extraction Zone. The player will be kicked to the menu after staying in this area for a certain amount of time. This creates a surprisingly small playground for the player to maneuver. In keeping with the small scale theme, the weapon roster is fairly humble. The most basic weapon in the game is the sword. This weapon is especially effective because all enemies in the game dies in one hit, either of their own bullets or strike of your sword, and bullets penetrate indefinitely. There are only 5 ranged weapons in Ubermosh. Most of them are fun to use in their own rights, with each having different bullet patterns. But once you get your hands on the best weapon in the game, you'll find yourself never using other weapons ever again. This is made difficult by the fact that, once you walk pass a gun dropped by an enemy, your character will automatically pick it up and use it. Avoiding unwanted weapons on the floor now becomes an active gameplay element as a result. Ubermosh is heavily dependent on reflexes. Enemies spawns are randon and usually outside of your viewing range. There are no visual indicators to suggest impending enemy fire, which makes dodging and reflecting bullets immensly challenging and heavily dependent on luck. Ubermosh provides players with the option of different modifications of your character. There is "Kensai" mode, where the only weapon the player could use is the sword. Being the opposite, "Gunner" mode completely remove the sword, leaving the player with the ability to shoot all guns automatically. "Warlock" mode gives the character the best weapon in the game and the sword, along with significantly reduced HP (reffered as "Respawns" in game). The game could also be switched to Hardboiled Mode, increasing the number of enemies in a level. Controls in Ubermosh are simple, snappy, responsive and perfectly serves the purpose of the game, a straightfoward arcade shooter. 

To wrap this review up, Ubermosh is an immensly entertaining game, especially for its price. Although it's flaws are quite glaring, the core gameplay is fun enough to make you forget about them. A great game to spend 90 seconds of your life on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112301934', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1538839441}
review:
难度高，要求反应快，挺不错的小游戏。
要我说风格最接近的，应该是《是男人就坚持20秒》系列。
游戏模式很简单，类似竞技场的一块固定场地里，四面八方扑面涌来无数敌人，你依靠障碍物和反应速度躲避子弹。同时用多种方法努力清场，直接粗暴。总之玩的就是心跳（手残党打了几分钟就知道要提高很难
对玩动作游戏有信心或者求虐的，可以一试。
PS：打折时卖1块钱，买不了吃亏买不了上当，说不定卖卡还能挣回来（虽然我还不懂什么叫卖卡，蛋别人都这么说我也跟着霍霍几声

author: {'steamid': '76561198079699689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1472118172}
review:
Vous incarnez un petit bonhome (enfin, madame, je crois) tout de gros pixel vétu. Vous avez une épée et un timer de 90 secondes. Le but du jeu est de survivre aux vagues d'aliens toujours plus nombreux en récupérant des armes sur les cadavres de xénomorphes à l'aspect ridicule.

Au final, un jeu d'arcade extrêmement bourrin, simple à appréhender, mais difficile à maîtriser, c'est nerveux et ça peut remplacer le café du matin pour vous mettre dans un drôle d'état d'excitation. L'OST, vraiment sympa, y est pour beaucoup.

On se surprend à appuyer sur les boutons pour en demander encore après s'être fait laminer plusieurs fois, et les 5 minutes que l'on pensait tuer se sont transformées en 30...

Bref, un petit jeu basique mais efficace, chopé à 48 cents avec la BO, il n'y a pas à hésiter un seul instant!

author: {'steamid': '76561198174487591', 'num_games_owned': 1829, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1472218612}
review:
In 90 seconds of life, this game offer the high doze of adrenaline rush.

Gameplay is simple, you can cut enemy bullet by your blade. Take enemy weapon, shot them. Get bigger weapon, kill them all as a soldier. Or become a master ninja who only equip blade to cut the bullet. In 90 seconds of life, this ain't easy to survive. Good reflex is the most requirement. And why this game is great on my book, because of its amazing soundtrack. It is perfectly blend with the gameplay that require a mood, adrenaline rush and good reflex.

Last word, if you want a simple game and had a challenge to test your reflex. I recommended this fantastic game, worthed of your time. Get full price to support developer or highly discount too if you want save money. It is worthed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130513127', 'num_games_owned': 1483, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1472104817}
review:
[h1]UBERMOSH —— 乌伯狂舞 [/h1]
简单粗暴的街机风小游戏

游戏内容很简单，在一块划定的区域里杀敌，你可以选择枪杀，刀杀或者弹反敌人的子弹
快节奏的街机风格：像素风画质，敌我一枪即死，分值为主要目的
配合带感的BGM，在敌阵中冲杀、弹反，快感十足
游戏时数较低，没有什么主线，做完成就可以算是通关了
（这设置得很合理，既能让玩家充分享受游戏所有的模式，又避免在游戏快感榨取干净后还无意义地反复刷）
现在还在94%off，一块钱买不了吃亏，一块钱买不了上当
唯一的缺点是没有关闭BGM的选项，在挂卡的时候可能对玩家有打扰

对成就有疑问或困难的同学可以移步[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=751373033]UBERMOSH全成就指南[/url]
最后，不要试图使用手柄进行游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198125304063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1532547065}
review:
Хотя я и поиграл в эту замечательную игру всего пол часа, я решил написать обзор. Суть игры заключается в том, чтобы вы рубили всех на мясо, получая за это очки. На мясо можно пускать как и с катаны, так и с пушек. Пушки в игре зависят от противника которого ты завалил, например, есть простые мудаки с которых падает кусок дерьма по одиночному выстрелу, собственно нихуя с нее не попадешь, но есть и пушка которая стреляет как дробовик. В общем, советую вам поиграть в эту игру:D И, чуть не забыл, в игре присутствует хард мод и разные режимы, например режим бить только с катаны, или же наоборот, с пушек. Рекомендую! 
10 разрубленых таракашек из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198182233446', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1471889135}
review:
Pros:
+Fun,challenging top-down shooter
+Soundtrack
+Price
+Diffrent gamemodes and mods to change gamestyle of the game
+Pixel graphics fit the game nicely

Meh:
=There could be a bit more story 
=There isn't a lot of content in the game

Cons:
-When changing gamemodes your high score resets for some reason
-When the enemy shoots the bullet doesn't come out of his gun but reather appears a bit in front of him. This is quite frustrating because sometimes when you are close to the enemy you my die from a bullet you didn't even see.

Final Verdict 8/10

Ubermosh is a fun little game that I can recommend buying on a sale which is a bit greedy but the game (even for it's price) has only about 15-30 minutes of entertaiment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017271295', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1471870564}
review:
UBERMOSH a choisi la carte du twin stick shooter dépouillé et décompléxé à outrance qui durant 90 longues secondes mettra vos réflexes et votre sang-froid à l'épreuve. 

Une expérience éphémère mais néanmoins ultra maîtrisée - notamment grâce au champs de vision réduit et au gameplay au katana - qui devrait vous occuper quelques heures, le temps de relever tous les défis... ou de perdre patience.

review: Суть игры - bullet hell с возможностью отбивать снаряды обратно в противника, а так же стрелять самому из подобранных пушек. Однообразная, но довольно занятная и сложная игрушка. Музыка после смерти - "ваще not bad".

author: {'steamid': '76561198031306027', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1471839530}
review:
这游戏在我愿望单里好久了，昨天突然发现搞了个94off，直接就1块钱大甩卖了，让我对这游戏的品质有了不祥的预感

游戏只有一张地图，平淡无奇的双摇杆，鼠标左键射击（游戏一开始无意义的捡枪是一大败笔），右键挥剑砍人同时也能防反。游戏特点在于可视范围很小，敌我双方的攻击都是带有一定的AOE性质，敌军以数量压制玩家，容错的空间很小，在你身后出现的敌人约不到0.5秒就能要你的命，所以难度很高，让我想起了之前玩的Tera blaster

游戏给差评的原因是因为我并没有看到什么Cyberpunk元素，让我觉得把这游戏放我愿望单里是个失误，OST也没有用心，就一首音乐Remix成了十几首，糊弄一下我就算了？

author: {'steamid': '76561198240972364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1472262183}
review: 低配版《血腥大地》

author: {'steamid': '76561198065346433', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1471913800}
review:
打折只有1块钱的游戏，并且还有卡，可以回本
游戏还是挺好玩的，那来消遣还不错
音乐很好听（？）
游戏里的那把刀挺拉风的，可以弹反敌人的子弹并且造成双倍子弹数量
模式大同小异，也没什么可以说的，就是能拿枪和不能拿枪和开始带把枪等
地图也只有一张，并且最骚的是地图不大而且有边界，如果你踏过边界的话你会直接GAME OVER。
唯一值得吐槽的是这廉价的界面UI
就像是随便画画就放上去的一样，并且只有5个选项：开始-教程-重置分数-选择游戏玩法-退出。
制作者似乎不知道什么叫选项，所以在菜单界面里加了成就显示和RANK系统，并且一点卵用都没有
还有就是女主角
为什么制作者会想到去画一个满脸紫色还带着绿眼球的。
具有莫名的惊悚感，一进游戏就被那张脸吓得够呛。。。


毕竟是个小游戏，不能要求太多，能挂卡回本是最吼的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198240573254', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1482363929}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012450975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1474538018}
review: 坚持XX秒系列，但画风实在接受不了，换个画风说不定是个好游戏。游戏性感觉还行，打发时间的游戏，有点像《血腥大陆》。右键挥刀反弹敌人子弹或直接砍杀。左键发射捡来的的枪子弹，没撑到过90秒。玩的时间太短，主要画面太烂，音乐还行，有点燃。打折可以考虑入了挂卡，原价的话，拉倒吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198144682162', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1558750369}
