author: {'steamid': '76561198110762959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1471693702}
review: За 2 часа игры заработал все ачивки, за это время третья карточка так и не выпала. Но игра стоит своих 9 рублей. Вроде бы обычная индюшатина, но что-то в ней есть. Для любителей "хардора" советую взять эту игру и выбить все ачивки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207163408', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1474367659}
review:
一块钱买不了吃亏，一块钱买不了上当。
趁着打折买的，游戏很简单，就是杀杀杀。
但是意外的有点高难度，各种十秒死亡，比较耐玩。
虽然被打了好评音乐的标签，并且买的时候也是和原声音乐包捆绑买的，但是我个人觉得背景音乐有点吵。

注意点：
没有设置功能，只能全屏游戏，音乐也不能关闭（可能是我没找到
虽然教程中指示的是使用键盘鼠标操作，但是我实测鼠标能用键盘不能用，如果用手柄的话可以完整体验操作。（这点也有可能是因为我键盘的问题因为我认识别人可以用键盘，姑且算是提醒

author: {'steamid': '76561198142947826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1477714733}
review:
刚开始就进入了遇到怪十秒必死的魔咒。。。
然后聪明机智勇敢帅气的我，
利用了地形
只需要三面受敌
终于过了无枪模式和最强的枪和普通模式
不能用刀的模式。。实在打不过了
总之上手后两只手非常爽~

author: {'steamid': '76561198311759625', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1471618234}
review:
玩了一会儿，给个好评，+1游戏中可以闲时拿出来玩一玩的趣味小游戏

只需一元，即可立刻畅玩是男人就坚持90秒，还附带具有一定魔性的BGM

其实90秒不是真正的目的，游戏真正的目的是在90秒内或在死亡前获得最高的分数，也就是击杀更多的敌人

我为了挺过90秒，选择了躲墙角的战术，结果发现这样得不偿失，因为虽然能活到最后，但是击杀的敌人却大打折扣，所以这个游戏就应该勇往直前，杀出一条血路，不放过任何一个见到的敌人

左上角可以选择模式，然后就点PLAY爽快的突突突吧 (●'◡'●)
============================================
全成就撒花，努力玩了好一会儿呢~~~

先是在无枪模式下被虐了个体无完肤，终于在无枪模式下拿够150分解锁成就以后，才发现还有个7次200+的成就，每个模式都尝试了不少把，发现还是无刀模式最适合解锁200+这个成就，因为无刀模式是唯一一个可以一直按着鼠标连发的模式，让杀敌变得效率了很多

7次200+完成后还剩一个7次存活成就，我在普通模式下补齐了缺少的存活次数（2次），因为普通模式最综合，可以用枪可以用刀，而且还有较高的4点生命值，比较适合存活（生命值就是游戏左上角的倒三角）

游戏在捡到比较高级的武器后就不会再捡起低级武器了，所以可以放心的在一地枪堆中来回穿梭而不用担心手中的好枪换成差枪，因此最高级武器这个模式就变成最坑爹的了，仅有两点生命值而且还不能连发

最好的方法还是选择靠墙打，这样可以让自己少面对一个甚至两个方向的敌人，自己目前也就最高打到350+，应该会有很多大神超过400

如果觉得赞同还请点个赞，有说的不妥的地方还请指教  (●'◡'●)
=============================================

最后有一点忘记说了

[spoiler]千万不要用手柄！！！！！[/spoiler]
[spoiler]千万不要用手柄！！！！！[/spoiler]
[spoiler]千万不要用手柄！！！！！[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067078195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1471436820}
review:
Se trata de un juego de acción indie en el que tendremos que sobrevivir a hordas de enemigos. Para ello, contamos con nuestra espada y las armas que dejan los enemigos o que recibimos si elegimos una de las clases permitidas al inicio de la partida, y que nos dan ventajas a cambio de "puntos de vida".

La jugabilidad es rápida y directa, tenemos que esquivar los disparos enemigos o partirlos con la espada golpeando en el momento adecuado. La cobertura del escenario también será importante para sobrevivir los 90 segundos del asalto.

Pros:
Buena música, estética pixel de los tiempos de la Amiga500 de estilo ciberpunk.
Contras:
Escenarios siempre iguales, poca variedad de enemigos.

Resumen:
Si lo puedes comprar a menos de 1€ vale la pena para echar unas partidas, además, puedes completar la insignia con facilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008665792', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1471615512}
review:
[h1] The colony provide us everything, except for violence... that, we still find in the deserts of Ultakaar. For now, welcome to UBERMOSH.	[/h1]

UBERMOSH é um jogo arcade frenético onde você usa armas  lasers foderosas e, corta inimigos e relefete os tiros igual ao um mestre jedi com sua espada. 
O game possui 4 classes diferentes: Warlock, Kensai, Gunner e No Class. Sendo que cada uma possui suas características.
Cada classe possui um número X de spawn core, que é a "vida" que o jogo utiliza. Levando dano você perde um spawn core, porém o jogo continua, sem dar uma pausa ou algo tipo para você se recompor e voltar para a partida. A partida só acaba se você perder todas as vidas ou se o tempo acabar, que são 90 segundos. Se você não se cuidar, pode perder todas as suas vidas num piscar de olhos, sério.
Além disso, o jogo não possui pause e também existe uma área no mapa que se você cruzar a linha, você sai do campo de batalha e retorna ao menu do game.

Jogo frenético com uma trilha sonora demais, que vai fazer você querer bater seus próprios recordes.

UBERMOSH é 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198124781570', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1471268617}
review:
[h1]Sevim Koş Bu Çocuk Yine Oynuyor Ubermosh[/h1]
Fazla söze gerek yok şaka bir yana şaka gibi bir oyun var karşımızda zaten. Oldschool grafik sevenlere şahane grafikler. Cyberpunk ve Metal tutkunları için efsanevi müzikler. Sinir katsayısı her daim yüksek olan o kitle için sonsuz bir aksiyon. Tek bir kötü yanı var oyunumuzun o da gerçekten zor ama çok zor olması, ölmek de öldürmek de inanılmaz kolay, bu nedenle her ölüşünüzde giderek sinirleniyor ve daha çok hırs yapıyorsunuz. Gayet cüzi bir rakam, türünün bilinen örneklerinden Crimsonland'ı oynamış ve sevmişseniz, kılıcım ve silahım bana yeter bana bitmeyen bir aksiyon ver diyenlerdenseniz, işte Ubermosh tam da size göre. İyi oyunlar dilerim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306433120', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1585247451}
review:
[b]UBERMOSH[/b] es un juego arcade casual en donde tenemos 90 segundos para sobrevivir ordas de enemigos sin evitar perder nuestras vidas. Es un juego relativamente corto, complicado, pero no imposible. Su mecánica es simple, usamos nuestra espada para atacar y cortar (regresar) las balas enemigas hasta que se acabe el tiempo, o hasta que nos maten dentro de una zona limitada.  Además cuenta con tres clases (Kensai, Gunner y Warlock) que nos hará un poquito más desafiante el juego sin contar el modo "Hardboiled" que es su modo difícil. Por último, creo que una de las cosas más destacables del juego es su soundtrack, puede parecer un poco repetitivo a veces pero es pegadizo y va muy bien con eso de rebanar oponentes. 

Es un juego ideal para echar una partida de vez en cuando. Y con el precio que tiene, es casi un robo de nuestra parte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202338901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1469549142}
review:
非常にシンプルな１分半生き残るゲーム
似たゲームならホットラインマイアミなどか。

簡単に死ぬし何も考えず突っ込んだらあっさり死ぬ、ただ中毒性は高い。
リトライが簡単だしモードも数種類ありモードによってライフも異なる。

無敵時間などなく連射されて被弾して終わる事もしばしばある。
敵の落とした武器と切り替えて戦い方を学ぶ死にゲーになる。

オプションなどなくフルスクリーンでしか出来ない所がマイナス要素になるくらいか。

author: {'steamid': '76561198125075603', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1551473933}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198037958977', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1471201796}
review:
Biggest concern is the camera bounds; the issue you face in any widescreen top-down shooter is that you can see much farther to the left and right than you can from the top and bottom. Ubermosh is pretty zoomed in, with that limitation plus how far towards the edge of the screen you can get when you're traveling to the top or bottom, you end up walking straight into enemies just as you first see them.

I like the quick decisions between firing or slicing, I like the music changes on respawn. I wish the attacks were less random, perhaps starting at a specific distance from the player and repeating constantly at that enemie's given fire rate while the player is inside it's radius. That and zoom out a bit and this mght be a pretty good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027819327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1472917018}
review:
What can I say about Ubermosh.

I've got it in the steam summersale.
It was kind of an impulse buy, like when you're in the
music store buying a heavy metal album from its cover art.

The soundtrack is superb. And while there are plenty of
games waiting in my backlog to be played, Ubermosh
just slided by those. I'm enjoying it as much as I'm bad
at it, and I'm enjoying it very much.

It's the sort of fast paced action you can put in between
longer games, or when you've got some minutes to spare. It 
has enough variation to keep you entertained. And challenged!

When I have been going at it with a class for about five times,
I switch to another. The differences between the classes give
you a change of approach to refuel your reflexes, when you
are trying the melee class the next time.

I've grown too old for bullet hell games.
Ubermosh has a hell of a lot of bullets flying around.
But it's the first time in a while I'm enjoying beeing in
the middle of a bullet armageddon. This may be 
because this is not quiet bullet hell game,
even though, well, bullets, everywhere.

Ubermosh had me at 
'cutting your enemies' bullets with your sword'

I'm just taking a break to have another go at 
trying to kill 150 enemies with their own
bullets. By cutting them in spreadshots.
And sending em back at them. 

If you are just even slightly interested in this 
game, you'll get a good impression of it in under 
two hours, so I'd recommend giving it a try. 
And refund it, if it's not your cup of tea. 

Happy bullet cutting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085013726', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1520702219}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033995000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1469222099}
review:
[h1] Лучшее, на что можно потрать 12р в стиме [/h1]
Итак:
+[u] Это стильно [/u]. Приятная пиксельная графика, киберпанковый дизайн, яркие выстрелы и кровь - выглядит игра потрясно
+[u] Это увлекательно [/u]. Геймплей действительно затягивает как минимум на час-другой, он интересный и динамичный.
+[u]Это круто звучит [/u]. Музыка шикарна, в меру агрессивна и драйвова, идеально подходит происходящему мясу.
+[u] Это хардкорно [/u]. Помнишь количество криков  и ударов по столу при очередной шальной пуле в Hotline Miami? Тут такого же будет много, [i]я гарантирую это[/i]
+[u]Это дешево [/u]. 12 рублей по скидке, 49 без - серьезно? Просто мастхэв за такие деньги, ничто не подарит такие эмоции

-[u] Это приедается [/u]. Как ни крути, но ничто не идеально, так и эта игра наскучит через 2-3 (если ты совсем упоротый - 5-6) часов, ибо в наличии всего 1 арена да несколько режимов, ах. Правда, на этот случай есть UBERMOSH:BLACK, но это уже совсем другая история..

[spoiler] боже, спасибо габену за кейсы по 70р, иначе я бы никогда не познал этот мини-шедевр [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197981776655', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1519136639}
review:
I was ready for the mosh pit, shaka brah <(^_^)> !

Do you think you are ready? To go moshing and beyond? If so, then it's hella time for you to dive into the bloody pit and start ubermoshing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020796334', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1468494917}
review:
[h1]I love it to hate it[/h1]

[b]UBERMOSH[/b] is a small, interesting, frantic arcade game where you have to shoot an reflect bullets with your sword. And that's it. I just told you the whole idea of the game.

But that's not the problem. UBERMOSH is quite interesting having a unique soundtrack and art style as well is really interesting and challenging gameplay. Even though there's not much to do in the game [spoiler](got 100% of Achievements in 1.9 hours)[/spoiler] it's still fun to play. I really like games that require fast reflexes and decision making because UBERMOSH really succeeds in that.

Unfortunately the good things stop there. Even though UBERMOSH was fun to play despite the repetitive gameplay it had more flaws in the game mechanics in the short amount of gameplay. The camera is way too close for you to react to anything that's a couple of meters away from you and the hitboxes and spawn points are glitchy... That's the real problem of the game. The enemy bullets will spawn in front of the gun. Not from the barrel of the gun which makes it very hard to predict when to reflect the bullets because you'll be already taking damage before you could even see the bullets. This combined with the extremely glitchy hitboxes makes the gameplay incredibly annoying.

Persoanlly I think that the game is super easy if you fix these problems which then leaves one question... Is the game flawed? Yes. Does it have potential? Yes. A lot. The mechanics are fun and the fast speed of the game makes it fun to play but just because the mechanics are glitchy and flawed there's really no reason to buy this game. If they would be refined UBERMOSH could be one of the best Arcade shooters of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147693983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1469005232}
review:
UBERMOSH is quite a game, I could describe it as a some sort of arcade Sci-fi  monster hell in which the main character wields a sword that can deflect bullets and you can grab the enemy's pistols for your own use.
The main goal is to survive for 90 seconds, you would say that is easy piecy but it isn't, the game is really hard and unforgiving, at the beginning you will survive less than 30 seconds, but the more you play it you develop an strategy to finally do it.

The graphics and it's optimization is well made and it aims to its purpose, the controls are responsive without a doubt, the only way you are going to die is by your own hand.

But you may be question me: "IS THAT IT?" and i can answer you with a "Yes and No"

UBERMOSH has several mods to play which consist on the normal mode, a mode where you can use only your sword, another that you can use only your pistol and a difficult mod that you can use your sword and the most powerful gun but you can only get hit twice, besides that you can change the difficulty to hardboiled mode which is harder.

But by the time you establish your strategy you have pretty much defeated the game with all of its mods (or at least that's what happened to me), and I'm not saying that is poorly designed, [i] au contraire mon ami	[/i], the game is well done but at least for me the challenge lasted about 30 minutes until I decided to get all of the achievement.

At the end of my review I would say that UBERMOSH is quite an entertaining game made for people who likes challenges,  on relation to it's value you won't feel defrauded with what you get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141197204', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1468036838}
review:
TL; DR - Fun and fast-paced game where you use blade to cut bullet from robotic AK-47.

Great time-waster that takes place in a futuristic, cyber-punk reality where killing things is (legal) entertainment.

You play as some badass grill with a fergalicious sword that she can use to CUT BULLET by right clicking. 
You murder aliens and other humans to take their guns in order to murder more aliens and other humans.

Each gun has a different type of bullet, be it large and firing one at a time or small, spread, and firing three at a time. There is a total of four (maybe five, I'm 90% sure it's four.) gun types, one of which can only be acquired by killing the big aliens.
You'll be able to tell by the yellow blood.
This gun is the strongest, as it shoots the most BULLET at a time.

The main objective of the game is trying to kill as many enemies as possible before you take too many hits or run out of time.
Your weapon selection and weapon attributes can be changed with class mods, which can be selected before you start playing.

Warlock gives you the best gun right off the bat and doesn't let you change it. You can be hit three times.

Gunner removes your ability to use your sword, but makes all your weapons auto-fire, making them shoot while you hold down the mouse button. You can be hit four times.

Kensai removes your ability to use guns, leaving you to only using your sword. You can be hit six times.

There's also this thing where you can change your gamemode to "Hardboiled" which I'm assuming makes it harder but I personally haven't noticed any difference.

I reccomend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075943714', 'num_games_owned': 5214, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1601059134}
review:
[b]Titel:[/b] UBERMOSH

Schießen, zerschneiden, töten - UBERMOSH.

Ubermosh ist der erste Teil der Serie und zeigt, was alles so ein kleines Spiel drauf hat. Ich habe mir echt nicht viel gedacht, als ich auf den "Spielen" Button in meiner Bibliothek drückte. Doch nach den ersten drei Sekunden im Hauptmenü wurden meine Ohren vom lauten Soundtrack erdrückt. Ab dem Punkt wusste ich... Ubermosh ist ein Kracher.

Man spielt eine sogenannte "Heilige" oder im englischen "Saint" und startet auf einem leeren Schlachtfeld mit paar Wänden/Bergen. Das einzige, was ihr seht, ist eure Figur mit nur nem Katana in der Hand. Sekunden später fegt die heftige Musik wieder eure Ohren weg und oben links beginnt ein Timer runterzulaufen. Währenddessen stürmen die ersten Widersacher auf euch zu. Eine unendliche Schar an Gegnern mit Lasergewehren will euren Kopf. Jetzt heißt es Überleben.

Zerschneidet Geschosse und stiehlt die Waffe eurer Gegnern. Nur so habt ihr eine Chance in der Arena als Sieger herauszukommen. Das ist UBERMOSH.

[b]Positiv:[/b]

+ gute Pixelgrafik
+ sehr gute & coole Soundtracks
+ Waffensounds sind ziemlich deftig (wenn man das so sagen kann)
+ sehr flüssiges Gameplay
+ herausfordend
+ verschiedene Klassen mit Vor- und Nachteilen
+ Cyberpunk Szenario gut rüber gebracht

[b]Negativ:[/b]

- ödes Leveldesign
- leider nur 2 Modi, die sich aber kaum unterscheiden

[b]Fazit:[/b]

Bombastischer Arcade Shooter mit Badass Musik - das für Mau. Klare Kaufempfehlung!

★★★★★ ★★★★☆ 9/10

👑 Powered by HoI 4 Deu  Kuratorengruppe auf deutsch/englisch 👑
🎉 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/30388691/] Folgen [/url] 
und mehr Reviews von mir entdecken 🎊

author: {'steamid': '76561198055717536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1527433215}
review:
すさまじいゲームスピードで展開する鬼畜死にゲー。

とにもかくにも強烈なアクをもったゲームバランスとなっている。
自分も敵も一撃死、攻撃を喰らい次第即死するゲームでジュワジュワ溶けていく
主人公が敵と違う点は、リスポーン・コアなるものをもっていて三回まで攻撃を食らってもよい(四回目で死ぬ)こと、薙刀で弾丸をはじけることのふたつだけである。

はっきり言って運ゲーもいいところで、画面外からいきなりスポーンしてきて避けられない弾をぶちかましてくる敵はいるし
どうせ一撃で死ぬので単発の銃は完全にハズレ扱いで、散弾を撃てる銃以外は持ち替えてしまうと事故る文字通りの地雷であり
薙刀も振れるレートが低すぎてやはり事故死しやすいという、とんでもないゲームバランスだが

その分リプレイがすぐにでき音楽もよく、死んだところで失うアイテムもない、死にゲーとしてそのあたりの必要な諸要素はきちんとしている。
この値段を考えれば非常に良い出来だろう。シンプルな死にゲーが好きなら、セールのときにどうだろうか？

author: {'steamid': '76561197980988545', 'num_games_owned': 1381, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1467703482}
review:
I realize everyone has there own opinions and preferences, but I seriously cannot understand how this game has a 90% positive rating from over 600 people. This is the kind of free flash game that you would see on Newgrounds.

One major problem is that the game is zoomed in so far that you cannot see what is happening around you. As you walk in any direction, you get even closer to that edge of the screen which gives you even less time to react when an enemy or projectile pops onto the screen. If you could see more of the game, you may be able to use a bit of strategy instead of just having swarms of enemies rush you from all sides with little to no notice before getting hit.

Also, there is no substance at all. You are in a bland arena with a few barriers scattered around and you can shoot or swing your sword. There are about 4 different guns, but they are all basically the same thing with the better ones shooting more projectiles at once. You basically just spam as many bullets as you can for 90 seconds and try to kill as many enemies as possible. It's best to spam bullets in all directions because you cannot see very far and if you do not kill the enemies that are approaching off screen, they will run you over from all sides.

I liked how the art style of the game looked and it sounded promising with all the positive reviews, but there is literally nothing to this game. There is no progression, almost no weapon variance, no levels, no story, no upgrades, there is literally no substance. I could understand if the game was still in early access and these things were going to be added, but it is not.

In it's current state I would not recommend this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092029204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1467800929}
review: Just discovered this gem. I fell in love instantly when I discovered there is no Pause feature. It was at that moment I said "Sweet Raptor Jebus, there is no pause... yes this is a REAL bullet hell game!!", as a Bullet Hell adict, I spit in the face of easy modes, save features, and such a silly thing like a pause button, there is no pause in the chaos and death known as True Bullet Hell gaming, don't you dare blink or itch your nose muhahah,it becomes a test of your own will and power over your own body and is a realm meant only for the relentless and hardcore. Indstrial metal thumps harder than Quake 2 tunes and drives the NON STOP violence. Life and Death is a supreme black and white factor in game, you survive by franticly avoiding bullet chaos, perfecting timing by repeling bullets, getting a good gun and trying to hold corners while at the same time avoiding picking up a worse one till it becomes too much and you bail. The art style is great as well. Luck, pure punishment, and a test of skill while making your own split second tactics, Yus, this game will give you Bullet Hell Zen, let go of the false self and simply be within the torrents of Bullets and Chaos. 10/10 Art style is epic as goat teeeets, real sweet stuff. Just wish it had a two player mode, or online co-op function.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963195774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1467363170}
review:
UBERMOSH is more fun than should be allowed for only $2. It does exactly what it sets out to do: "give you a shot of adrenaline in a couple of minutes." You run around and shoot/slice anybody else in the pit for up to 90 seconds. That's it...And it's perfect.

Guns feel appropriately powerful, the sound of your sword deflecting enemy bullets is satisfying, and each enemy you K.O. leaves a little puddle of success so you clearly know they're down. The colors of incoming enemy fire stand out from the background and enemies are highlighted by a bright ring at their feet, which is great because you'll be looking everywhere all at once. The action is challenging but not frustratingly difficult. Even if you fail, you can be back in a new round quickly. The short rounds give you incentive to get out there and brawl without the fear of losing progress.

I spent a [i]long[/i] time eyeing UBERMOSH, which is stupid considering its ridiculously low price tag and the fact that it's perpetually on sale. Don't make my mistakes. Buy UBERMOSH.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996319480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1542543613}
review:
Si quieres que te duela la muñeca después de estar jugando durante varias partidas a un juego difícil pero increíblemente adictivo, este es tu juego. Lo he comprado en rebajas por 47 cent y creedme vale la pena la verdad, es un bullet hell muy adictivo y difícil al principio. A pesar de tener un único mapa tiene varios modos de juego entre ellos solo espada, espada y armas con diferentes cantidades de vidas. Gráficamente tiene una estética de la época de los 8 y 16 bits. Tiene varios problemas que pueden ser resueltos con una actualización: entre ellos que no tiene modo ventana, que no hay algo que te indique que te han dañado de forma clara ya que hay muchos proyectiles y se pierde la visión de la vida, tampoco tiene una animación clara de muerte o de que pases los 80 segundos que tienes que sobrevivir para pasarte el modo de juego. Es simple pero rejugable tanto como quieras. Puedes desestresarte y pasar un rato desahogándote y distrayéndote simplemente disparando e intentado sobrevivir. Además rebotar balas con la espada siempre es un plus.

Lo recomiendo? Si, y si lo pilláis de oferta como yo con mas razón todavía.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972202664', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1481831340}
review:
"The colony provides for everything...except for violence..."

UBERMOSH is like a top-down Devil Daggers.  You appear in an arena and are tasked with surviving 90 seconds of relentless onslaught.  90 seconds isn't much, right?  And all of the enemies die in a single hit--how hard could this possibly be?

As it turns out, hard as fucking [i]nails[/i].  Set to a thrumming metal and techno soundtrack (which is easily one of the best things about UBERMOSH), you will die again and again and again.  Fortunately the game subscribes to Edmund McMillen's "Super Meat Boy" model, wherein dying happens quickly and restarts are virtually instantaneous.  This game doesn't want to waste your time--it just wants 90 seconds.

Depending on your class*, you may begin with a sword; use it to relieve an opponent of one of a handful of different firearms.  Some of these weapons are great.  Some aren't so great.  Fortunately (as I previously mentioned) enemies die as quickly as you.  Therefore the best weapons are those that allow you to spread death around fastest.  Within 30 seconds of a single game, you'll have access to every available weapon--pick the one that works best for you.

*[i]There are several unlockable classes that are fundamentally different takes on the same thing:  One can only use a sword, one starts with the best weapon, etc.  And each has a different number of allotted respawns.  They impact the game, but not in a radical way.[/i]

The game is stripped of all but the barest essentials--there's nary a plot, an economy, or an exposition.  UBERMOSH doesn't have time for those sorts of formalities.  And because of that, the game's a great shot of adrenaline whenever you've got more than a couple of minutes to stop and play it.

Who might like this game?  Anybody who wants a no-frills top-down shooter that's hard as hell.  People who love a soundtrack that makes you want to kill, crush, and destroy.  For those who played Devil Daggers and thought, "You know, I wish this game was remade as a twin-stick shooter."  For $1.99 this game is a solid deal; for $0.49--[i]the price of upgrading a burger to a goddamn cheeseburger[/i]--you'd be a fool to skip out on this game.   

PROS
+ Great Soundtrack
+ Super accessible drop-in/drop-out model 
+ Very challenging

CONS
- Lame Steam cards, emoticons, and wallpapers.  Seriously, the wallpapers are just black backgrounds with a circular shape and the emoticons are colored spurts.
- Weapons could use a little more variety

author: {'steamid': '76561198138988029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1467142853}
review:
Juego adictivo y difícil por igual tu único objetivo es sobrevivir un minuto en un terreno hostil llenos de enemigos y ya esta no necesitas más es una locura este juego y te hará gritar del oído y volver a empezar con más furia 

Pros.

Una música buenísima para ponerte más loco aun matando alienígenas del averno.

El cortar las balas con la espada es gratificante.
 
Contras.

Antes de iniciar con mis contras, sepan que este juego lo hizo una sola persona y que seguramente en un futuro próximo actualice el juego…. O no, bueno a la fecha de esta publicación estas son mis contras.

No hay más mapas, solo es un única mapa con una extensión algo reducida y a la larga se puede tornar algo aburrido estar en el mismo mapa.

No hay un indicador o animación de muerte, te salta una pantalla de golpe y te saca mucho de la inmersión es difícil de explicar, igual cuando logras sobrevivir. 

No hay modo ventana, a mí personalmente me jode vivo u.u
 
Y este punto es muy personal: hay diferentes tipos de seres con unas formas y unas armas específicas, pero todos mueren de un disparo, seria genial que cada uno tenga diferente resistencia quizás el que tiene la mejor arma aguante tres disparos o más, pero repito esto es algo muy personal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026454771', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1472460868}
review:
Purtroppo, valuto negativamente questo titolo.
Lo so, sono perfettamente al corrente di quanto poco abbia pagato, e tutto sommato il gioco si regge in piedi bene, almeno nella fase di gameplay.
Tralasciando la qualità del menù, la meccanica di gioco funziona bene.
Il problema è che c'è talmente poco materiale da giocare che la longevità può benissimo ridursi a 5 minuti.

Ripeto, sono perfetamente daccordo che per 1 euro non dovrei aspettarmi nulla di chè, ma dopo il primo minuto di gioco si è visto praticamente tutto e non c'è alcun buon motivo per continuare a giocare, apparte coloro che hanno intenzione di migliorare il proprio punteggio (non io).
Preferisco pagare dieci volte di più e avere buona varianza e longevità piuttosto che un euro per un titolo che mi dura una sola sessione di gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005247539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1467767803}
review: Fun, fast-paced,  affordable. These are all points in favour of Ubermosh. I took a chance on this game because it cost next to nothing and I'm glad i did. It's a very simple arcade-style arena survival game. The swordplay is what makes it compelling. It feels great to deflect shots back at your enemies. The character classes also add variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072253557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1711887415}
review:
It's a high-octane, heavy-metal-fuelled adrenaline surge. You start out tense, watching your timer tick down as you wait for the first enemy to appear, and then immediately you're frantically dodging and deflecting and firing wildly into a horde of... monsters? Robots? Cyborgs? The 8-bit graphics should be pretty simple to figure out; but honestly I've never had time to take a proper look -- I'm too busy trying to kill everything that moves.

It's a simple and straightforward game with no real catches or snares -- you fight for your life for 90 seconds or as long as you can hold out, and try to beat your score. You can modify your starting loadout/abilities (they're practically the same thing, which isn't a bad thing at all in a game like this -- it's super simple and intuitive), you can increase the difficulty further if you like, and there are a few entirely option badges to aim for if that's your thing. Again, the badges are simple and straightforward; but they're still going to require you to draw on different skillsets and strategies if you want to complete them.

For $2 you get a game which is *exactly* what it looks like on the tin, but still offers the depth that makes it worth coming back. This game isn't trying to be anything more than a fast, hard-hitting bullet hell/arena arcade game; but it works perfectly within that niche so if that's your niche as well then you'll get a good deal here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983015538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1455636764}
review:
총을 쏘거나 적을 베서 죽이는 액션게임
스토리 같은 건 없고 그냥 점수만 쌓아 올리는 게임이다.
본인은 엑박패드로 이 게임을 했다. 타격감은 좋았지만 
단순히 점수만 쌓아 올리는 게임이기 때문에 금방 질리게 된다.
게임 컨텐츠가 부족한 게 큰 단점이다.
요즘 모바일 게임도 이렇게 컨텐츠가 적지 않다. 과거 피쳐폰 시절 게임 중에서도 초기 게임 수준이다. 
가격에 적당한 게임이라고 생각함.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290428885', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1462631073}
review:
一款不错的双摇杆射击游戏，体量小，但配合上不同的模式和成就系统就让人停不下来。

优点：
1.便宜，打折后挂卡回本
2.游戏流程还算有趣，掌握技巧后杀杀杀还是很爽的
3.既然名字叫《UBERMOSH》，那音乐自然是不错的了（否则怎么能mosh得起来）。除了音乐带感，游戏的音效也不错，女战士光剑出鞘的那一声，啧啧啧
4.女主人翁，星际女战士的设定挺冷艳，也很酷

缺点：
1.全成就后容易丧失游戏动力

小技巧：
1.找到最好的红枪后背靠墙刷怪，只面对三个方向的敌人，游戏会简单很多

总之，打折到六块以下的话推荐购买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198069175557', 'num_games_owned': 3715, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1465088944}

サントラ聞くだけだと出ないのは私だけ？）

音量や画面調整等のオプションがないのはマイナスですが
お手軽な値段でアクション好きにはもってこいだと思います。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198074006136', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1465669565}
review:
Estoy erecto ;---------->D

Ahora en serio es un juego alucinante para su precio. El gameplay e muy divertido y entretenido.

Lo basico del juego es lo siguiente:
Tienes una espada que devuelve las balas de los enemigos. Cuando matas a un enemigo este pierde su arma. Hay 4 modelos de armas. Cuando consigues la mejor que es como una escopeta que dispara muy amplio no cojes mas armas. Digo que es la mejor porque ademas de que el propio juego lo indica es la que mas balas dispara y la que mas amplio. Da igual lo pequeñas o debiles que parezcan las balas porque matan siempre y a mas de un enemigo.

Ahora entra lo complicado. Cuando tienes muchos enemigos tienes que decir si disparar o acuchillar. Disparar el arma te puede quitar a 4 o 5 enemigos cercanos pero no te permitira acuchillar en casi un segundo (creerme que es mucho). Si matas a alguien disparando creo que el tiempo de volver a disparar se reduce. CREO. Si escojes acuchillar devolveras las balas en un cono bastante amplio, casi 90º. Pero puede que no mates a tantos enemigos y si no matas a nadie te quedas rodeado por 10 enemigos que es morir.

El juego incuye unos cuantos retos como conseguir una puntuacion especifica con ciertas clases. Tambien tiene un modo hardcore que reinicia el juego. Aun no lo he probado pero seguramente actualize.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198790893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1683035137}
review:
I bought this game on sale
I'm not entirely sure if it's worth it's normal price, but it's definitely worth the $.49 I paid for it.

The game is rad. Slicing and dicing bullets, blasting enemies, what more could you want.

The soundtrack goes very well with the gameplay.

Four different classes to choose from each with it's own perks, I found Kensai to be my personal favorite.

It's easy enough to pick up and play and there are achievements that'll keep you going.

The only thing that kind of sucks is that the achievements are pretty easy.

Don't stop until you're a Blade Saint, because there is no stopping in the deserts of Ultakaar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137052569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1463844109}
review:
Хорошая убивалка.И цена хорошая.Игра создана для того,чтобы расслабиться,отдохнуть.
Любителям подобного однозначно брать!

author: {'steamid': '76561198171055098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1485541354}
review:
Absolutly amazing game.
Hardcore grinding with cyberpunk seasoning. A terrific soundtrack, it goes well with the death of my countless enemies.

Only one con: achievements easy to clear, even in hardboiled mode the "blade saint" is not too much a challange. To be honest, the stay alive for the whole event wasn't easy.

Absolutely worth its price.

EDIT: one thing - I played the game for 3 hours, completed all achievements, played in hardboiled, got the "Blade saint" point, but only 1 card drop from the 3... For the instant fun I will surely play this game for some hours, but the 3 card should be already dropped during this first few hours.

EDIT2: ok, thx for Amicus Ignis for pointing out, that for the first 2 hours there is no card drop. It slipped my mind. :) Still, cool game.

review: 這是一個快節奏的動作遊戲。遊戲最大樂趣在於武器為鎗劍混合，遠距用鎗近距用刀，撿鎗換鎗及用刀快速反切子彈，配上音效與手把震動效果，可以享受純粹殺蟑的痛快感。有多種遊戲模式選擇，都是嘗試在90秒內存活下來。基本只要保持揮刀半徑距離的圓與注意反擊時機，全成就不難。

author: {'steamid': '76561198205661812', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1488320158}
review:
Ubermosh é excelente Arcade Game onde você tem que sobreviver durante 90 Segundos ( Tenho mais de 4h de jogo e ainda não consegui :v ) isso faz com que o jogo tenha um Ritmo muito rapído  o que combina com a trilha sonora que é impressionante, você joga, joga denovo, e a música dá vontade de escutar mais. O barulho da espada cortando as balas, com um som de rock por trás, dá uma batida sem igual ao game.

O Jogo possui 6 modos diferentes e cada um possui sua propria dificuldade (Eu gosto bastante do modo Kansai onde vc só tem a espada como arma), Recomendo você testar todos e ver em qual você é melhor mas o que me prendeu foi o fato de que o o tempo é pequeno e isso te faz jogar várias vezes pra tentar melhorar seu resultado.

Altamente Recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561198075645628', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1462179795}
review:
[b] UBERMOSH [/b] è un gioco  arcade dove il vostro obiettivo sarà abbattere più mostri possibili e sopravvivere alla fine della partita. Prima che loro avranno la meglio su di voi.

Vi ritroverete in un arena,con una musica fantastica (che vi consiglio di sentire a tutto volume) e partirà una sessione di gioco frenetica,divertente e complessa.Complessa perché i mostri sono davvero veloci e dopo pochi colpi sarete morti,quindi all'inizio risulterà  difficile finché non prenderete la mano e vi abituerete alla velocità di gioco.

Secondo me si ritrova alcune pecche,ad esempio la visuale è un po' troppo zoomata e a volte i nemici appaiono dal nulla senza che voi riusciate a vederli in tempo,ma piano piano vi abituerete anche a questo continuando a tentare.La seconda pecca è la durata e la poca rigiocabilità,le sessioni di gioco sono molto corte se riusciste a vivere e purtroppo essendo solo un'arena,stessi personaggi e stesso sistema,dopo averlo finito non lo toccherete più,non avendo altro da fare,anche se il gioco contiene pure una modalità più difficile chiamata Hardboiled che vi darà magari qualche altra ora di gioco,se avete la pazienza di rigiocarlo.

La cosa buona è che se siete dei tipi a cui piace finire i giochi al 100% è il gioco perfetto. Essendo veloce e complesso,è un ottimo gioco da completare e vi regalerà stress e soddisfazioni.

Beh che dire? Preso in offerta  49 centesimi e sono stati soldi spesi bene,durante i saldi lo troverete spesso a poco e vi consiglio di dargli un'occhiata,anche se corto saranno 2 orette di puro rage e frenesia.

 My only gripe would be the borders on top and on bottom of the screen, maybe there's a setting somewhere I missed... but if not, it's no biggie. Got it on sale for 50 cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018485266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1462097627}
review:
Turn the beat around

身为一名星际战士应具备的素质是什么？用光剑弹反子弹？不用上弹夹的枪？
如果你在火卫上用电锯斩过恶魔，在博爱之城炸过洪魔就明白
一位合格的士兵想要打败外星坏蛋，没个几首个人主题曲是不行的
跟着节拍晃动你的脑袋，抓住手柄乱摇扎进敌群吧！你很快会习惯开场不到10秒就挂掉的

To the nitty gritty

节奏爽快，简单轻松的小游戏
没有太多的技巧需要学习，有时运气和临场发挥一好稍微努力一下就过了
游戏分为4类模式，基本的几个成就也是要求杀敌150后存活即可
一局不过90秒，建议使用手柄，全程震动还挺带感

author: {'steamid': '76561198003142691', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1460383201}
review: Clocked some offline time with this one, though I may return to it soon. It is one of the most approprietely priced and advertised games I've seen on steam. It plays well with an xbox controller and with a mouse & mouse. It's fun and has a decent soundtrack. Honestly it's just a great game for slicing and dicing and it's cheap. It's hard not to recommend because of how cheap it is and how much fun I've had with it. Watch a video of gameplay, if it looks appealing to you, it almost certainly is. If gameplay does not look appealing to you - avoid it. You get exactly what you see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148622583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1460222137}
review:
[list]

[b]极端硬核向复古双摇 极端困难! 极端易死！[/b]
[b]在这里你会经历死亡！频繁的死亡！以及更多的死亡！[/b][spoiler]对于手残党而言则是无尽的死亡QAQ[/spoiler] 
基本死个几百次就上道了 能从一开始每局几十分逐步上升到150分 150分是个坎 基本这个时候多数玩家都会出现平台期 提升困难
如果你能忍住不摔手柄删游戏 再死个几百次就会相对容易的达到200分 不过这个时候还是要看运气 [spoiler]170 180 190分时被弹幕封路是常有的事情╮(╯_╰)╭[/spoiler] 
目前已全成就 最高分290+
Wellcome to Ubermosh！你值得拥有

author: {'steamid': '76561198121199959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1486736212}
review:
FRE-NÉ-TI-CO

Ubermosh consiste em partidas de (até) 90 segundos nos Desertos de Ultakaar, fora da Colônia que: "...provides us everything, except for violence."

O jogo tem um ritmo muito rápido, você vai ter que se acostumar com sua velocidade e comandos, mas a vontade é de jogar de novo e de novo pra bater seu placar, melhorar o rank, ou alcançar as conquistas. Não se preocupe que nada faz mais parte desse game do que morrer. Só aperte play de novo!

A trilha sonora é uma marca do jogo, que traz batidas alucinantes que casam completamente com ele, vale a pena comprá-la junto.

E existe quem conseguiu bater todas as conquistas, e se acostumar com Ubermosh. Por isso existe: Ubermosh Black.

Have fun in the mosh pit ♥

author: {'steamid': '76561198196827891', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1558984669}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126882465', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1552422341}
review:
Un juego estupendo para su precio.
En mi caso no me ha costado más de [b][u]50 cent.[/u][/b] por una oferta dónde me venia con un pack.
Diria lo mismo que dijo el Sr. SOY BATMAN:
[quote=SOY BATMAN] Me siento sucio pagando 1€ por este juego...[/quote]

Ubermosh es un juego dinámico, rápido y de muy cómodos controles; Con clásicas mecánicas senzillas de top-down roguelike y una música tecno magistralmente motivadora que []mola que te cagas.
Y, por supuesto, no podían faltar muchas [b]mierd.as láser de colores[/b]. WORTH.
Perfecto para partidas breves pero intensas... Sólo le falta un poco más de variedad de armas y dinosaurios, dinosaurios robots comunistas gigantes, a poder ser.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960497623', 'num_games_owned': 780, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1459211707}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993538945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1458996281}
review:
Great challenging game to kill a bit of time on, It's pretty similar to games like Robotron or Smash TV. It's frustrating in the first 10 minutes but after about 30 minutes you start to appreciate the challenge.

This game was obviously crafted with love. The soundtrack to this game is awesome. It's like a cross of synthpunk/speed punk from the 80's. The game plays well with both controller or keyboard/mouse.

For the low price it's a great little game to add to your library. But be warned, it's not for the faint hearted. Controllers could get thrown, mice smashed and keyboards destoyed

in the Ubermosh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138854820', 'num_games_owned': 1501, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1475419898}
review:
UBERMOSH是款讓各位壓力大發洩的遊戲 
這款遊戲講求手速 讓人可練出電競選手的速度 又可以發洩壓力阿
雖然我玩常掛點 但覺得讓女朋友(x 進化了
音樂對喜歡聽電子音來說不錯
價格蠻算便宜 加原聲帶也150 超划算

author: {'steamid': '76561197996519790', 'num_games_owned': 2271, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1690879426}
review:
That game rocks. I am really happy I found this gem.
Fast and full of action and sound and after 5 minutes you feel better without a bad aftertaste. When you are looking for a "lot of time playing for your buck" you are wrong, but when you have taste for a good mixture of art and action you are right. 
Basically this is THE game that I played 200 seconds (7 roundss or so) the first time, instantly understood everything and still had a good feeling afterwards. That is quite unique, normally when I am done after 200s in the first try it is also the last. Not with ubermosh. Thumbs up and strongly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000604423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1458412551}
review: "UBERMOSH" wäre ein durchaus nettes Spiel, hätte die Spielfigur nicht das Sichtfeld in der Größe eines Bierdeckels. Die meiste Zeit schießt man ins Blaue und wird von Viechern getötet die scheinbar aus dem Nichts auftauchen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278740230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1458253123}
review:
For a little over 2 dollars you can buy a candy bar or a soft drink from a store. However for the same price you can buy a pretty sweet game that goes by the name of Ubermosh.

Similar Games:
CS GO 2D and the Hotline Miami series are what I can think of right off the bat.

Gameplay: 
The rounds start off with a trickle of foes, you might even wonder where's the action? Well no worries, in around 10 seconds the screen will be filled with a deluge of pixel foes who wish nothing more than to delete your sorry ass from the arena. 
To combat these hordes of incoming foes you can choose 3 distinct classes, each with their own playstyle. The classes are Kensai, Gunner, and Warlock. 

The Kensai is the most durable of the three but is restricted to using the blade only. 
The Gunner has no defensive abilities besides dodging bullets, however she gains the ability to go full auto with her guns, like the saying goes, the best defense is a great offense.

 The Warlock gives you the best gun right off the bat and lets you swing your sword, sounds pretty OP right? It is, to a certain extent, but you only have 2 health (Although you can deflect bullets leading to a debate if the Warlock actually is less durable than the Gunner.) 

If you don't want to be restricted by class, running without a class is a good way to get into the flow for Ubermosh.

Pros:

Cheap
Faced paced action
Sense of satisfaction when you do well

Cons: 

Spawns are wonky sometimes
Can get repetitive with only one map
Gets frustrating if you force yourself too much

Would I recommend this game? Hell yes, for the low price of 2.19 it's definately worth it, although you may wish to buy Ubermosh Black instead for a similar price if you are willing to devote 1 more dollar to this kind of game :).

author: {'steamid': '76561197994465523', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1507841538}

author: {'steamid': '76561198109628359', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1601635553}
review: The idea of cutting the enemies bullets works so well and makes this one of the few games to truly express the saying, 'Easy to learn, hard to master.' Although each round is only 90 seconds the game just sucks you in and you will end up playing for hours. This is hands down the best $1 I've ever spent. This game is worth every penny you put into it, whether it's on sale or not. Another bonus is the amazing sound track that gets you super pumped and makes you feel even more badass while cutting bullets with a sword. The class mods bring a fun and difficult challenge to the game. I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes fun indie games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245670120', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1482717758}
review:
I got a coupon for this game from a friend and it was well worth getting. Cutting bullets with a sword and arcade-style gun-toting mayhem all rolled into one amazing package. The soundtrack is adrenaline-fuelled and it makes you want to keep on going. The class mods also add an interesting spin with each one having different effects.

If ever cyberpunk mosh pits become real, I want them to be like this. My only complaint is that there is some occasional slowdown when there's too much going on on-screen but it was only a minor occurence and did nothing to detract from the fun that this game is.

Well recommended and good for a quick burst of high-octane action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098371901', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1607225150}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021922182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1544075275}
review:
There are only a few things that can be said for Ubermosh; almost none of them are negative. It's a simple game, really. You're thrown into an arena, tasked with killing as many enemies as you can, while simultaneously trying to last for the duration of the event. There are several guns, and a blade which allows you to cut enemy bullets, winging them back at the shooters. I can't level any worthwhile complaints at the mechanics of the game. If this was all that Ubermosh offered, it would be a solid - albeit, lackluster - game. However, I haven't touched on its best parts, yet.
At its core, Ubermosh is a frenzied bullet-hell shooter. It's arcade-y in all of the best ways - simple, clean, and addictive. But, this isn't what makes Ubermosh so much fun. No, it's the chaotic, electric-neon adrenaline rush the game manages to create. 
The soundtrack for Ubermosh fits the gameplay and visual style completely. The gritty, pounding electronic vibes blend perfectly to the frenzied tempo of pulsing laser weapons and slashing projectiles. Visually, Ubermosh conjures something akin to the neon-drenched arcades of Gibson's Sprawl Trilogy; it's a mix of static and pixelated splashes of vibrant color. 
Ubermosh is a simple game, yes. Simple enough that some might consider it a negative. However, it's a steal at $2 - well worth the price of admission. 

Ultimately, Ubermosh is an addictive, pulse-pounding pixelated frenzy of a game; it's a game with the look and sound of a cyberpunk dream, which delivers frantic combat. And, I can't help but recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277011659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1457315167}
review: How can a game don't have any options/settings? Or am I completely blind? Other than that the game have decent music and graphics. The gameplay on the other hand is...rough. The camera follows your crosshair, which means if an enemy comes from behind you won't see him until it's too late. The hitbox for your character is ridiculous. You have to imagine that the character is twice the size. You can't run along walls either, you will stick to them like glue. All and all, based on price it's a decent game, by far nothing to get excited about, limited variation on characters, levels and enemies. But at least it cheap...If you can find on sale, I can be worth the money. 5.0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970618148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1457284781}
review:
Ubermosh is like a drug - you'll always be chasing a better high (score). The pumping soundtrack serves to put you in a trance, to better slay all before you. It's a fantastic way to get a quick and satisfying rush.

Your aim is to get as many kills as you can in 90 seconds without losing all your lives. You do this by shooting and deflecting projectiles back with your sword. You move with WSAD and attack and aim with the mouse but a controller is supported as well. It feels a lot like Hotline Miami but with less emphasis on doors and planning. It's simple and it works.

It did get a little dull after I got all the achievements but it's still excellent value, especially with a soundtrack like this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001881399', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1500319315}

author: {'steamid': '76561198160468371', 'num_games_owned': 1004, 'num_reviews': 361, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1573783854}
review:
Eu comprei esse jogo em uma promoção, apenas por ser brasileiro. Não entendia muito essa de sobreviver por 90 segundos, imaginava: "Pra quê comprar um jogo de 90 segundos de duração?". Pois bem, passaram-se horas e minutos para conseguir atingir esses 90 segundos em alguns dos modos de jogo.

Esse jogo me lembra dois jogos de que gosto muito, um clássico nos anos 90, chamado [url=https://archive.org/details/arcade_robotron][i]Robotron X[/i][/url], por conta das cores vivas e pelo modo frenético de se jogar, seu modo de jogo é bastante semelhante porém elevadamente mais difícil.

Sua trilha sonora é formidável [strike] e custando mais do que o próprio jogo[/strike], te prende em todos os momentos em que é tocada, tão rápida quanto o próprio jogo em si. É o que chamamos de "casual perfeito"!

review: UBERMOSH - это когда ты ждешь; становишься в угол с винтовкой имеющей максимальный разброс и ждешь. 90 секунд. Всё. Далее опционально: ты сворачиваешь игру, убираешь в системе звук, т.к. звук в игре никак не регулируется и местный саунд продолжает играть даже когда игра в свернутом виде, и ждешь пока повыпадают карточки, коих тут 3 штуки. Дабы как то скрасить ожидание и  можно подождать в углу с винтовкой 7 раз, чтобы получить ачивку. Даже и не знаю что тут порекомендовать... Наверное не покупать эту игру.

review:
[h1]This game is just [b]pow bang ZAPP![/b][/h1]

The neon-artstyle fits so perfect and remembers me of Hotline Miami and Far Cry: Blood Dragon. Really bling bling.
The [i]bullet-cutting[/i] is pretty neat stuff, but the overall weapon selection is kinda humble/modest.
And what really annoys me, is that some enemys spawn exactly 1 millimeter next to you! What happens ?! [b]You die![/b]

All in all it's a really fun game and definitely one of the best time killer for sure!
[u]If you like fast-paced games, this one is for you!
Hop on and enjoy the ride ma brethren and sistren.[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198164557965', 'num_games_owned': 5145, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1491027724}
review:
8/10，简单且爽快的双摇杆砍杀游戏。
说真的，这种类型的游戏真的做不了太差，这个游戏算是一个典型。
简单粗暴易于上手，在数十分钟内就能找到节奏慢慢开始进步，十分好玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097584463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1455906750}
review:
Übermosh is an intense ride through and through. You get 90 seconds to survive and take down as many gun-wielding alien goons as possible, and initially, you only get a sword. You bring a knife to a massive gunfight. Luckily your blade is capable of reflecting and splitting enemy fire and forcing them to eat their own bullets.

Graphically, the game is very simple, but effectively incredibly intense. You'll see classic pixel sprites and a constant smooth 60fps throughout. It's also incredibly color and plain fun to look at.

Gameplay wise, this game is a roller coaster. You get a few different classes to choose from, and each of which you'll have to master if you plan on 100% completing this game. No Class Mod has you start with a sword only, but allows you to pick up enemy guns, and you get 4 hits before you fall. Kensai allows use of only the sword, but you get six hits before game over. Gunner gives you a fully automatic gun at the cost of your sword and give you only three hits. The last and frankly best class is Warlock, which gives you use of the sword and the best gun in the game right out the gate. However, just two hits and you're down for the count. Completing this game requires you to get 150 points with each class, 200 points with any class seven times, surviving the full 90 seconds seven times, and attempting (but not beating) Hardboiled Mode. If you love games that are purely score-based and are easily motivated to beat your own high score, this game is tailor-made just for you and I guarantee you'll have hours of fun.. If you don't break your mouse. By the way, I do highly recommend using the keyboard and mouse over a controller. I personally find the twin-stick shooter controls awkward and troublesome. It works smoothly and everything, but it's simply not my cup of tea.

The music in this game is by far the best element, and the developer was smart to include the soundtrack as DLC. I can't really describe it well but I guarantee you could listen to it while fighting off an alien invasion and be pumped and focused the entire time.

I absolutely recommend this game to anyone looking for a fun, difficult time killer! It's hectic, fast-passed and difficult, so beginning gamers may have a tougher time, but give it a bit of practice and you'll have it completed in a matter of hours.

9/10

TL;DR

PROS:
- Incredibly fun
- Incredibly high replay value
- Best soundtrack on Steam. No joke.
- 100% completed very quickly if you're focused and skilled
- The badges and cards aren't bad either

CONS:
- Very high difficulty - not recommended for newer gamers
- May cost you a mouse or two if you're easily frustrated

author: {'steamid': '76561198205169597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1556704674}
review:
Having bought the game after 'A Kind Ale War' (Australian youtuber... watch him you) I knew what I was getting into and I can say that it does not dissapoint.

It is a simple game; you spawn on an alien planet with a sword and some Health. You deflect an aliens bullets back at him, kill it, take its gun and kill everything else until you die. Its simple but fun; and its gameplay is sploffing fantastic. There are a few modes, in one of which you spawn with the best gun in the game and you go on a rampage; another limits you to your sword (I love it) and another limits you to your gun.

There is a Hard mode for you suicidal folks out there which is not needed because the game is not easy, far from it. Not that its hard to learn, its just hard in general; you are going to need twitch skills to avoid jumpscaring damn Aliens coming out of the corner of your screen.

What about the problems? Well, there is one. One huge one. There is not enough content; as soon as you spawn and play for a Min or so (if you do not die) you have seen most of the content on display. I reccomend a few updates to the game to increase its content; new enemies, new maps (I wanna see a jungle damn you!), new weapons, new everything! This game has a fantastic OST and its gameplay is perfect, if it were to have more content it would be a fantastic game.

For now its a very good game in its own right, little bursts of gameplay for the lols every now and again (because the loading times are brilliant) are nice, but if you dont give me enough content to keep my intrested I will not stay intrested and I will go off to play a game with more substance.

I rate it a 8/10. Why not less because it has little content? Well, look at its price. Its great value, every pence you put towards this game will be rewarded with a good amount of content. Bang for your buck.

PS: You know that announcer at the start? I want to get that guy's voice in my life.

EDIT: After a few hours of writing this review, I not only discovered that the developer cannot change the game any more without adding entire DLC's or games, but I discovered that there is another version of Ubermosh. UBERMOSH: BLACK. Not only are the breasts on the main character improved but it has various other addons. I'll throw my money at it and see how it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053492926', 'num_games_owned': 1378, 'num_reviews': 565, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1615501103}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043963783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1452677211}
review:
Twinstick shooter with only one objective: kill as many rando enemies withing 90 seconds as possible without dying.  You start with a sword, but can pick up guns enemies drop (can only hold one at a time).  Sword swipes can chop enemy bullets in half and reflect them back.

Great soundtrack, pretty tight controls and satisfying feedback with a controller.  Mouse and keyboard work fine too, but I prefer the controller.

Could use more level and enemy variety, but that's my only gripe.  Great game in short bursts.  Best $0.50 I ever spend.

Fiddy/10

Difficult, but worth every frantic button-scrambling moment. author: {'steamid': '76561198036821356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1455461658}
review:
This game has a simple premise and equally simple mechanics, yet is so compellingly addictive; it really resonates that Hotline Miami style 'one more go' vibe.

You are flung into an arena with one sole objective; kill everything that moves until time runs out or you yourself are killed. The controls are slick and though, as mentioned, simplistic, becoming competent with them is very satisfying, especially with the 'Kensai' class mod, in which you are only equipped with a sword and must slice and reflect bullets to end your enemies. 

Ubermosh is admittedly short on content, though it's base price is reasonable, and on sale, is definitely a worthwhile purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273345230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1530398623}
review:
Bom, comecei a jogar o game hoje. Então ainda vou falar pouco. 
Comprei o game pela trilha sonora que é impressionante, você joga, joga denovo, e a música dá vontade de escutar mais. 
O barulho da espada cortando as balas, com um som de rock por trás, dá uma batida sem igual ao game.
Até agora consegui o rank B, mas o jogo leva a querer melhorar isso, a passar um bom tempo jogando, sem nem perceber.
Uma grande variedade de armas, que faz com que eu sempre queira pegar a que limpa uma maior onda de inimigos!
Não tem como ficar nervoso, ou frustrado. Pois o tempo é pequeno e te faz entrar logo pra tentar melhorar seu resultado. Bom, recomendo o game! Muito divertido 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116247897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1454830506}
review:
The colony provides us everything. Except for violence.

The gameplay is simple and fairly conventional. You run around and kill aliens with gun and sword, racking up as many kills as you can within a time limit. This game takes it to the next level with absolutely top notch presentation. The music is fantastic. The weapons are satisfying. There's no plot, but there's a hint of a setting that I find intriguing. I hope to see more.

There are a few classes, but they don't really change the gameplay significantly. Instead, I'd say they're better served as training tools. No class is the best all around, but you can learn from the weaknesses of the other classes and come back as a better player.

There are a few flaws. It's very easy to get stuck on the walls, and hits seem to my eye a split second before you actually see collision with enemy bullets. It took a bit of practice to get used to the timing with the sword for that reason, and it can be difficult to know why you died because there aren't any visual cues when you take your last hit.

Those are minor issues, though. This game, for its limited scope, is fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027873223', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1454548457}
review:
Ubermosh is a top-down cyberpunk roguelike indie action game. The plot of the game is that you're in the distant future where there's no violence and your only rage-outlet is an arena filled with monsters. The point is to survive as long as you can with a sword and various guns, and that's easier said than done. 

In its current state Ubermosh is a really great game with an amazing soundtrack that begs you to come back for more. If you want to test your reflexes and hand eye coordination I would highly suggest this game. Buy the bundle, you won't be disappointed. 

I did a UI review which you can check out here: https://youtu.be/4WrfE-r5BEo

author: {'steamid': '76561198017512754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1496528051}
review:
Comme quoi, les recommendations Steam apportent des fois de vraies bonnes surprises ! 
Ubermosh en fait partie ! Outre le titre franchement bizarre, on a là un jeu ultra frénétique. 
Dans la veine d'un Hotline Miami (mais dépouillé de tout aspect narratif), ce shooter en vue de 3/4 consiste à survivre dans une zone pendant 90 secondes contre des hordes de bad guys/aliens.
Le gimmick vraiment sympa du jeu, c'est le clic droit qui permet de dévier les balles adverses. Chopez un flingue, et c'est parti pour le carnage ultime... avant de mourir comme un con xD ! 
On meurt beaucoup et très vite, mais le jeu à un côté addictif super prenant. Les runs sont très courtes, la difficulté va grandissante et la musique nous scotche littéralement à notre clavier et notre souris (sérieux, prenez le en bundle avec l'ost).
En clair, un bon petit jeu pour bien se défouler, qui vous durera une petite poignée d'heures mais qui comble à merveille les petits vides de la vie :D !
Enfin, le jeu à été fait (développement, musique) par une seule personne. Chapeau !

author: {'steamid': '76561197981123622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1474650641}
review:
UBERMOSH is a fantastic little game, like a pocket-sized version of something like Nuclear Throne. You may only last a few seconds depending per game (my best score is 101 but generally I'm really bad at this game!) but it always leaves me wanting more. Having "a quick go" on UBERMOSH sometimes leads to an hour or more of me just deparately trying to get a good score. The core mechanics are just so strong and simple that I find it incredibly addictive and genuinely rewarding when I get a decent score.

Speaking of scores, the soundtrack to this game is great heavy stuff that's so much fun to blast monsters to. The sound design in general is really good, the sword and lazer noises are hugely satisfying and I love the announcer voice that plays over the intro.

All in all you're getting an incredibly tightly made, very addicting isometirc shooter for a tiny sum of money. An absolute bargain!

author: {'steamid': '76561198262864341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1456711677}
review:
I just didn't find it very fun.  It was a little interesting to try the different character classes with different perks.  But in the end it just didn't hold my interest at all.  The reference to "great soundtrack" is based on your preference in music, and I thought it was pretty generic, and don't plan to listen offline.  I prefer the character class with no gun and just focus on reflecting bullets.  I kind of wish there was some strategy or progression of some kind (not that there were any claims).  The game is exactly what is seen in the videos and screenshots. [2/5]

Ran perfectly on my Windows 10, Alienware Alpha.  Gamepad support was fine.  No technical issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986317878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1455723772}
review:
Presently I am gaming on a low-end PC laptop running Windows 8.1,which is able to run Source games well if I turn the graphics settings down low.

Games likes this shoud be perfect for this computer. However, my FPS goes way down any time the screen gets cluttered with enemies, projectiles, or blood splatters.

That and the "shakey camera" feature that many games utilize in order to make gameplay more immersive and dramatic can make dying in Ubermosh feel cheap sometimes. This is a great looking game with a great soundtrack, and gameplay can be very fun, and I might experience no problems at all if I were running this game on a higher-end machine, but I also feel that games like this mostly cater to casual gamers with lower-end equipment. There's no plot, and the gameplay couldn't be more simple.

While I love the fact that when the battlefield is strewn with the exploded corpses of enemies it looks like a modern-art masterpiece, maybe design a way to turn off some of these mechanics in order to reduce slow-down for people using lower-end (but still relatively new) computers. A radar feature might also help get the jump on enemies that are approaching from areas that are off-screen, to give the player more of an edge against the computer. It feels cheap when your health is low and you path directly into an enemy's projectiles when you didn't know to move or shoot at them because they were off-screen.

While the soundtrack and sound effects are very cool, it'd be great if there were an option to adjust the volume, or turn them off altogether, without muting my computer's speakers.

Right now this is easily a 3/5 game that could be 4/5 with just a little work. 

Fun, great looking, great sounding game, at a good price, despite whatever issues I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026709029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1454036000}
review:
This is like a fictional video game prop you saw arcade goers playing in a 1980s sci-fi film.

It starts with a large, gray disco ball and an ominous riff. Then a title screen with some cyberpunk girl. Her hair is as equally fantastic as her giant shoulder pads. Pick a mode and start the game. Morgan Freeman makes an announcement. Something about the colony providing everything, except for violence… and some other stuff. The glorious electronic-punk soundtrack.

Right click swings your giant bullet-reflecting plasma sword. Slice through endlessly spawning enemies. Grab a gun from their peanut butter and jelly corpses that litter the desert floor. Left click shoots. More corpse jam. Grab a better gun. Gunfire is making my sub beg for mercy. Die. A lot. Try different modes. One restricts to sword-play only. One has rapid fire guns. One has the best gun. Die more. Set a high score. Break it. Trade in my high score for Hard Boiled mode. So many more enemies. Mash right mouse button as I wade through the chaos, an ubermosh.

One more time.
One more time.

It's 3 am and I have to go to work in a few hours.

Buy this game. It's just as fun as those kids in the 1980s sci-fi films made it out to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032453716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1514573772}
review:
A potential masterpiece of retro gaming. Fast-paced, yet not too punishing, easy to play, hard to master, nice visuals, original gameplay.
Needs more location variations and/or larger and more diverse arena.
Needs melee opponents.
Needs co-op.
Overall solid 5/7, although not entirely worth the full price until these things are added.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048752110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1452665613}
review:
Take Hotline Miami
put it in a blender with Nuclear Throne
mix it up, then pour it through a really fine strainer, so all you get is the core top-down shooter gameplay
add a sword that can deflect bullets 
set it in a dystopian cyberpunk arena 
and your main characters is a cross between Leeloo from 5th element and Space Marine. 

That's Ubermosh. And it's totally worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077898343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1491966115}

>See which games are on sale

>Play it

>Restart
>Die immediately
>Restart
>Get 10 kills
>Die
>Learn to change class mods
>Do slightly better with each game
>Reach personal best of 100 while timer counts down to one second left in match
>Die

review: Wanted so much to like this game, and it was good fun at first. But when the game starts to slow down, and show all it's major flaws, it's clear to see that I'm getting hit by the air, and that the bull shit hit detection is the main reason I will get no where with this game. I'm done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208731177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1453041870}
review:
Глубокий сюжет, отличная ролевая система, интересно прокачивать персонажа. Диалоги, конечно, не очень хорошо проработаны, но всё равно достойные. Графика - консольное мыло, но по мне нормально, всё-таки в такие игры не ради графики играют. В целом огромное количество вариантов "отыгрывания" персонажа, нелинейный сюжет, несколько концовок, так что
рекомендую.
И да никогда не запускайте её перед какими-то важными событиями в важей жизни, поскольку велик шанс их пропустить! Потому что аааааа что просходит, она бьет мечом, нет, не бьет, а щас уже бьет, ах ты, ну щас я, ды как же так, а это вообще она или он, ну щас я всех сделаю, ах ты, ну всё понял как надо, аааааааа, дааааа, нааааа.
Как-то так.
Берите, не пожалеете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207713425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1471045904}
review:
сначала не обратил внимания на эту игрулю, но сегодня снова ее заметил и таки решил купить
и она ПОЛНОСТЬЮ ОПРАВДАЛА ПОТРАЧЕННЫЕ ДЕНЬГИ

эта игра получилась когда эпилептический припадок сожрал Crimsonland, Alien shooter и Hotline miami, а потом блеванул ими в ведро с киберпанком!

отличный ненавязчивый сандтрек, приятный геймплей, чудесная пиксельная графика, короткие партии(90 секунд), разноцветная кровища инопланетных уродцев, рандомные уровни, несколько режимов и достаточно высокая сложность - все это делает из игры прекрасный таймкиллер 
короче покупкой доволен и рекомендую

ах да, там еще приятного вида баба в меню

12 окровавленных лазерных сабель из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198039079280', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1523638050}
review:
Отличный таймкиллер, выполненный в пиксельном виде. 
Очень экшеновая игра и чем-то пронастольгировала знаменитый "Ailen shooter".
